## Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Joey_               Date: June 06, 2010, 09:09:06 PM  
---  
There is already a topic about the author Michael Langford, who coined this  
term 'awareness watching awareness', but I would like to hear your opinion on  
his interpretation of Self-Attention.   
Michael Langford describes the way he came to this conclusion like this.   
 "... (I wondered) If I AM is this present awareness, just the awareness  
that is now looking at this room, then paying attention to the I AM is just: **My awareness watching my awareness**.   
Atleast in my opinion this sounds true and is logical. And this is how he  
describes the practice itself: "Turn your attention away from thought and  
watch the watcher, see the seer."   
When he first found this out, he asked Sri V. Ganesan (grand nephew of Sri  
Ramana) about this practice and he approved it saying that he calls it  
'attention attending to attention'. Michael Langford also backs this  
interpretation by giving quotes from "The garland of Guru's sayings", by Sri  
Muruganar: The only true and full awareness **is awareness of awareness.   
Till awareness is awareness of itself**, it knows no peace at all.   
Is it not because you are yourself Awareness, that you now perceive This  
universe?   
 **If you observe awareness steadily, this awareness itself as Guru will  
reveal the Truth**.   
" **If with mind turned towards Awareness and concentrating on Awareness, one  
seeks the Self**, the world made up of ether and other elements is real, as  
all things are Awareness, the one sole substance of true Being."   
" **If instead of looking outward at objects, you observe that looking**, all  
things now shine as I, the seer. Perception of objects is mere illusion."   
" **The ego image moves reflected in the mind 's waves. How to stop this  
movement, how to regain the state of stillness? Don't observe these movements,  
seek the Self, instead**. It is wisdom to gain and abide in silence."   
Also Michael James says that Michael Langford's intepretation is correct.

## Re:[1] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: snow                Date: June 07, 2010, 03:43:52 PM  
---  
Quote  
Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self-  
Attention?  
Yes, that is what Sri Bhagavan clearly says.   
"What is essential in any sadhana [practice] is to try to bring back the  
running mind and fix it on one thing only. **Why then should it not be brought  
back and fixed in Self-attention? That alone is Self-enquiry (atma-vicara).  
That is all that is to be done! "**   
Now what is the Self that we are to fix our attention to? Bhagavan answers: "You ( the Self ) are Awareness. Awareness is another name for you." So this  
practice could as well be called 'Awareness-Attention'.   
In Nan Yar Bhagavan also calls this practice by the name 'ahamukham' which  
means I-facing (and therefore could also be called 'Awareness-facing').   
I don't know if anyone cares, but one of my favourite teachers Shinzen Young  
says that he practiced mindfulness of breathing in the beginning of his path.  
And after some months of practice he asked for more advanced method from his  
(zen) teacher. His teacher replied: "A more advanced method? Some people have  
practiced mindfulness of breathing for twenty years and are still learning new  
things every day. But you asked for a more advanced method, so here you have  
it: "Find out who you really are".   
Shinzen then asked 'how?', to which his teacher replied: "Just do it." And  
when Shinzen asked for some tip, his teacher said: "Turn the light (of  
consciousness) on itself."
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100706192826/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg15937](http://web.archive.org/web/20100706192826/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg15937)

## Re:[2] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Graham              Date: June 07, 2010, 04:22:32 PM  
---  
That which can be objectified can be watched - awareness watches the object.   
How can Awareness/Self be watched? Who is watching? It just IS.   
These explanations are at the root of all errors. ... 'are there two, one to  
watch the other'.   
Self-enquiry is NOT this method. Self-enquiry is holding onto and remaining as  
Self/Awareness of Being. A subtle but profound difference.   
Whatever can be objectified is not Self, it is just another thought, another  
figment of the imagination.
 ---

---  
Sri Ramana clearly has even talked about stages in Self Enquiry: "First the Self Sees itself as Object, then the Self sees itself as Void, and  
finally, the Self sees itself as Self, only in the last, there is no seeing,  
as seeing is being"   
Its all stages, each person moves ahead in his/her own way.   
When Faith is sincere, there is only one way ahead, going upwards the mountain  
peak, any direction upwards takes you to only the peak of the mountain and no  
other destination. It may only appear that each person is taking a different  
route to different destination, but a person with complete faith in his Guru  
can only Go Upwards to the Source - peak - Self.   
Salutations to Sri Ramana

## Re:[10] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 10, 2010, 07:09:23 AM  
---  
Dear snow,   
"Being aware" is not "watching awareness". How can it be?   
I am aware I am tall or short. Am I watching my shortness   
or tall height, every moment?   
I am aware I am having high fever. Am I watching my feverishness?   
I can at best watch into the thermometer after placing it under my   
tongue once in two hours. Otherwise I am not watching my   
feverishness. My wife may watch it, by placing her hand on my   
forehead. That is all. Watching needs a thermometer or a second person.   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100706192826/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg15937](http://web.archive.org/web/20100706192826/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg15937)

## Re:[11] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 10, 2010, 07:44:47 AM  
---  
It something like, even Bhagavan has said in some context (just a vague  
reflection), do we ever need to see that we are man/woman, etc...   
does anyone ever have to watch himself to affirm that he/she is man or woman,   
we know intrinsically that we are man/woman, we do not need to watch ourselves  
to know that I am man,   
I know I am man... I know I am a woman. similarly, can awareness ever watch  
itself? it is impossible   
to watch something implies subject and object. awareness being itself the  
subject and object, there is a great difference here, awareness cannot watch  
itself for it itself is awareness. if at all there is any watching, then be  
assured that those are your own making, ideas, notions, imaginations, etc...  
about awareness.   
awareness still needs to take birth.   
Salutations to Sri Ramana

## Re:[17] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: snow                Date: June 21, 2010, 01:02:04 PM  
---  
I find there to be some contradictions between Sri Bhagavan's and Michael  
Langford's teachings. Michael Langford says that awareness watching awareness  
should be always done eyes shut, but Sri Bhagavan said that it is totally  
immaterial in Self-Enquiry and actually sometimes advised vichara to be done  
eyes open.   
Also, here is a dialogue with Sri Bhagavan and a questioner: D.: I do not understand what I should do.   
M: **If it is anything objective the way can be shown objectively. This   
is subjective.**   
D.: But I do not understand.   
M.: What! Do you not understand that you are?   
D.: Please tell me the way.   
M.: **Is it necessary to show the way in the interior of your own home?   
This is within you.**   
And here is another one   
D: "How to make the Quest, Who am I?   
M: " **The way is subjective, not objective; so it cannot and need not be  
shown by another**. Is it necessary to show anyone the way inside his own  
house? If the seeker keeps his mind still, that will be enough."   
Michael Langford however, gives atleast ten descriptions of his practice.
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100707015732/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg15943](http://web.archive.org/web/20100707015732/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg15943)

## Re:[18] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 22, 2010, 06:59:23 AM  
---  
Dear snow,   
I agree with you. The problem with commentators is that they   
vitiate the essence of original message of the Master. For example,   
take Sri Sankara. He said Advaitam, the One without a second.   
But his followers were trying to out-do Sri Sankara. Subsequently,   
as one may see in Panchadasi and other works, there are two schools under Sri  
Sankara, the Bamati School and the Bhatta School. One says that one will have  
still the sports of Maya veiling him, till he attains videha kaivalyam, that  
is leaving the body in liberated state. The other school says Maya stops the  
sports, once you kill the ego, which is only Maya-swarupam. Both have a set  
of arguments to support their views. The whole essence of Advaitam is lost in  
this lingual diarrohea of commentators. If one attains   
advaitic siddhi, one should stop commenting. If you start addressing someone  
as different from you, you accept duality.   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100707015732/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg15943](http://web.archive.org/web/20100707015732/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg15943)

## Re:[19] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: viswanathan         Date: June 22, 2010, 12:25:43 PM  
---  
Ongoing through the comments on Awareness Watching Awareness of Micheal  
Langford,doubts are expressed by members of this forum that awareness  
watching awareness cannot be the state of BEING.If the members go through  
the complete text of Mr.Langford, it will be clear that it is same as self  
enquiry.Mr. Micheal very clearly explains that Awareness watching awareness is  
nothing but turning our attention inwards.He has categorically mentioned that  
Awareness Watching awareness is Awareness Being Awareness   
He has clarified that because of long ancient habit of looking outwards  
towards people places and things,the word watching is used in practice  
instructions and that way we take the same habit of watching the people places  
and things and we shut our eyes and turn inwards.That is why the word watching  
is used.   
My question to devotees is that whether any of the member is able to turn his  
attention inwards without effort.As for i am concerned, I am not able to turn  
my attention inwards with out effort and the moment effort is lost,  
immediately mind turns outwards.The effort is put by Ego and not by Self and  
when ego comes in, then the thinker comes into play and so the duality.When a  
question was put to bhagavan on Choiceless Awareness(effortless awareness)  
advocated by JK(which is same as state of being), Bhagavan replied that it is  
same as Summa Iru and if one can attain that state then it is fine.However  
Bhagavan says that due to age old vasanas, a person cannot attain Choiceless  
awareness without effort and hence continuous effort is   
required.Tamil being an ancient language any ideas can be expressed very  
clearly without any distortion in Tamil.Bhagavan has composed most of his  
works in Tamil.Once it is translated in other language especially english, due  
to want of proper words, the meaning gets distorted even though the author  
may like to give exact meaning.Watching also falls in that category.

Awareness Method is always to be done with the eyes closed."   
Where as Sri Bhagavan answer to the question whether eyes should be open or  
not like this: A: It may be done either way. The point is that the mind must be introverted  
and kept active in its pursuit. Sometimes   
it happens that when the eyes are closed the latent thoughts rush forth with  
great vigour. It may also be difficult to   
introvert the mind with the eyes open. It requires strength of mind to do so.  
The mind is contaminated when it takes in   
objects. Otherwise, it is pure. The main factor in dhyana is to keep the mind  
active in its own pursuit without taking in   
external impressions or thinking of other matters.   
And here is another quote: Question: Is it enough if I spend some time in the mornings and some time in  
the evenings for this atma-vichara? Or should I do it always, even when I am  
writing or walking?   
A: What is your real nature? Is it writing, walking or being? The one  
unalterable reality is being. Until you realize that state of pure being you  
should pursue the enquiry. If once you are established in it there will be no  
further worry.No one will enquire into the source of thoughts unless thoughts  
arise. So long as you think I am walking or I am writing, enquire who does  
it.

## Re:[24]TAT TVAM ASI  Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: srkudai             Date: June 24, 2010, 03:26:44 PM  
---  
Friends,   
 If we do not get "dogmatic", I think Awareness Watching awareness is just Self Inquiry. I do not understand why we have a problem with this method.   
After all, what the author is saying is: 1\. "You are Awareness" [Awareness is Brahman - SAT CHIT ANANDA, All  
Scriptures say this]   
2\. "turn away from the objects and put all attention on awareness" [Drop all  
objects and meditate on Brahman alone].   
3. "Rest in awareness" [Let the "I" remain with its source]   
I do not see any problem with this teaching. How many amongst us are really  
convinced that "I am Awareness" ?   
Why are we not convinced, if we are not? Ramana said it, Scriptures say it !   
This person, I am not aware of his actual life style, is just saying turn away  
from all objects and remain as Self.   
When a thought comes "I am hurt", revert attention to that which is aware of  
this. Though the wordings may sound different this is EXACTLY SELF INQUIRY.   
Observing awareness is not Self inquiry. But detaching from everything and  
remaining as Awareness is Summa Iru - JUST BE. Only problem will be mind will  
not allow it, it moves out. So the practice is to bring it back to the  
Awareness.   
Sitting meditation or sitting with closed eyes will be useful intially. But  
eventually it has to be 24 hours, eyes open or closed.

## Re:[27] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 25, 2010, 07:22:05 AM  
---  
Dear everyone,   
If one can take Awareness Wathing Awarness is Being Awareness,   
all problems do get solved.   
In another paragraph of the article of Michael Langford, I believe   
that he had said that there are 10 methods. This again poses   
problem. There is only one method, self attention or Summa irutthal. Being  
still.   
I checked up Michael James who has worked with Sri Sadhu Om,   
and who has thoroughly learnt Tamizh. He says about the   
practice and number of hours: 1\. There is no fixed time. One can keep regularity of say half an hour or 1  
hour per day. This may be increased in course of time.   
2\. During other times, one should do either work for his livelihood   
or necessity but not turn the mind outwards towards unwanted things., like  
watching the road, watching other people, watching   
useless programmes in TV or reading worthless books etc.,   
3. Regarding closed eyes and open eyes, Bhagavan Ramana said to Annamalai Swami that closing the eyes, would keep the mind free, without using the senses, and so the mind will be more vigorous   
in thinking about various things. It is like throwing a ball on a wall, by  
standing closer to the wall, the ball would bounce back more vigorously since  
the distance to be covered would be less. Keeping the eyes open, can at least  
tell you that you mind is going outwards and seeing things that are worthless.  
The mind plus   
open eyes is better controlled than the mind plus shut eyes.   
Arunachala Siva.

## Re:[29] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 26, 2010, 11:26:31 AM  
---  
Dear srkudai,   
Muruganar says in Padamalai Verse 2399: Through His gentle smile, radiant Padam joyfully declares: "Why   
this distress? Be happy by just REMAINING till".   
This can also be viewed in the context of the following from   
Maharshi's Gospel: Bhagavan: Your duty is to be, and not to be this or that. 'I am   
that I am' sums up the whole truth. THE METHOD IS SUMMARIZED IN 'BE STILL'.   
And what does stillness mean? It means 'destroy yourself', because, every  
name and form is the cause of trouble. 'I-I' is   
the Self. 'I am this' is the ego. When the 'I' is kept up as the   
'I' only, it is the Self. When it flies off at a tangent and says,   
'I am this or that', I am such and such', it is the ego.   
Verse 1217: Since becoming established in the state of the Self is both the  
means and the goal to be attained, remain still.   
Talks No. 322 is as under:-   
Question: What should one do in order to remain free from thoughts as advised  
by you? Is it only enquiry 'Who am I?'   
Bhagavan: Only to remain still. Do it and see.   
Question: It is impossible.   
Bhagavan: Exactly. For the same reason, the enquiry 'Who am I?' is advised.   
Verse 2328: The wonderful meaning of the supreme world [summa iru] is to know  
and rest in the Atma Swarupa through the enquriy   
'Who am I?'   
Verse 2114: Except by remaining still [summa iruttal] by what great tapas can  
the Atma Swarupam be attained in the Heart?   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---

## Re:[17] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: snow                Date: June 21, 2010, 01:02:04 PM  
---  
I find there to be some contradictions between Sri Bhagavan's and Michael  
Langford's teachings. Michael Langford says that awareness watching awareness  
should be always done eyes shut, but Sri Bhagavan said that it is totally  
immaterial in Self-Enquiry and actually sometimes advised vichara to be done  
eyes open.   
Also, here is a dialogue with Sri Bhagavan and a questioner: D.: I do not understand what I should do.   
M: **If it is anything objective the way can be shown objectively. This   
is subjective.**   
D.: But I do not understand.   
M.: What! Do you not understand that you are?   
D.: Please tell me the way.   
M.: **Is it necessary to show the way in the interior of your own home?   
This is within you.**   
And here is another one   
D: "How to make the Quest, Who am I?   
M: " **The way is subjective, not objective; so it cannot and need not be  
shown by another**. Is it necessary to show anyone the way inside his own  
house? If the seeker keeps his mind still, that will be enough."   
Michael Langford however, gives atleast ten descriptions of his practice.

## Re:[18] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 22, 2010, 06:59:23 AM  
---  
Dear snow,   
I agree with you. The problem with commentators is that they   
vitiate the essence of original message of the Master. For example,   
take Sri Sankara. He said Advaitam, the One without a second.   
But his followers were trying to out-do Sri Sankara. Subsequently,   
as one may see in Panchadasi and other works, there are two schools under Sri  
Sankara, the Bamati School and the Bhatta School. One says that one will have  
still the sports of Maya veiling him, till he attains videha kaivalyam, that  
is leaving the body in liberated state. The other school says Maya stops the  
sports, once you kill the ego, which is only Maya-swarupam. Both have a set  
of arguments to support their views. The whole essence of Advaitam is lost in  
this lingual diarrohea of commentators. If one attains   
advaitic siddhi, one should stop commenting. If you start addressing someone  
as different from you, you accept duality.   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---

enquiry.Mr. Micheal very clearly explains that Awareness watching awareness is  
nothing but turning our attention inwards.He has categorically mentioned that  
Awareness Watching awareness is Awareness Being Awareness   
He has clarified that because of long ancient habit of looking outwards  
towards people places and things,the word watching is used in practice  
instructions and that way we take the same habit of watching the people places  
and things and we shut our eyes and turn inwards.That is why the word watching  
is used.   
My question to devotees is that whether any of the member is able to turn his  
attention inwards without effort.As for i am concerned, I am not able to turn  
my attention inwards with out effort and the moment effort is lost,  
immediately mind turns outwards.The effort is put by Ego and not by Self and  
when ego comes in, then the thinker comes into play and so the duality.When a  
question was put to bhagavan on Choiceless Awareness(effortless awareness)  
advocated by JK(which is same as state of being), Bhagavan replied that it is  
same as Summa Iru and if one can attain that state then it is fine.However  
Bhagavan says that due to age old vasanas, a person cannot attain Choiceless  
awareness without effort and hence continuous effort is   
required.Tamil being an ancient language any ideas can be expressed very  
clearly without any distortion in Tamil.Bhagavan has composed most of his  
works in Tamil.Once it is translated in other language especially english, due  
to want of proper words, the meaning gets distorted even though the author  
may like to give exact meaning.Watching also falls in that category.

Friends,   
 If we do not get "dogmatic", I think Awareness Watching awareness is just Self Inquiry. I do not understand why we have a problem with this method.   
After all, what the author is saying is: 1\. "You are Awareness" [Awareness is Brahman - SAT CHIT ANANDA, All  
Scriptures say this]   
2\. "turn away from the objects and put all attention on awareness" [Drop all  
objects and meditate on Brahman alone].   
3. "Rest in awareness" [Let the "I" remain with its source]   
I do not see any problem with this teaching. How many amongst us are really  
convinced that "I am Awareness" ?   
Why are we not convinced, if we are not? Ramana said it, Scriptures say it !   
This person, I am not aware of his actual life style, is just saying turn away  
from all objects and remain as Self.   
When a thought comes "I am hurt", revert attention to that which is aware of  
this. Though the wordings may sound different this is EXACTLY SELF INQUIRY.   
Observing awareness is not Self inquiry. But detaching from everything and  
remaining as Awareness is Summa Iru - JUST BE. Only problem will be mind will  
not allow it, it moves out. So the practice is to bring it back to the  
Awareness.   
Sitting meditation or sitting with closed eyes will be useful intially. But  
eventually it has to be 24 hours, eyes open or closed.   
Love!   
Silence

## Re:[29] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 26, 2010, 11:26:31 AM  
---  
Dear srkudai,   
Muruganar says in Padamalai Verse 2399: Through His gentle smile, radiant Padam joyfully declares: "Why   
this distress? Be happy by just REMAINING till".   
This can also be viewed in the context of the following from   
Maharshi's Gospel: Bhagavan: Your duty is to be, and not to be this or that. 'I am   
that I am' sums up the whole truth. THE METHOD IS SUMMARIZED IN 'BE STILL'.   
And what does stillness mean? It means 'destroy yourself', because, every  
name and form is the cause of trouble. 'I-I' is   
the Self. 'I am this' is the ego. When the 'I' is kept up as the   
'I' only, it is the Self. When it flies off at a tangent and says,   
'I am this or that', I am such and such', it is the ego.   
Verse 1217: Since becoming established in the state of the Self is both the  
means and the goal to be attained, remain still.   
Talks No. 322 is as under:-   
Question: What should one do in order to remain free from thoughts as advised  
by you? Is it only enquiry 'Who am I?'   
Bhagavan: Only to remain still. Do it and see.   
Question: It is impossible.   
Bhagavan: Exactly. For the same reason, the enquiry 'Who am I?' is advised.   
Verse 2328: The wonderful meaning of the supreme world [summa iru] is to know  
and rest in the Atma Swarupa through the enquriy   
'Who am I?'   
Verse 2114: Except by remaining still [summa iruttal] by what great tapas can  
the Atma Swarupam be attained in the Heart?   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---

## Re:[17] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: snow                Date: June 21, 2010, 01:02:04 PM  
---  
I find there to be some contradictions between Sri Bhagavan's and Michael  
Langford's teachings. Michael Langford says that awareness watching awareness  
should be always done eyes shut, but Sri Bhagavan said that it is totally  
immaterial in Self-Enquiry and actually sometimes advised vichara to be done  
eyes open.   
Also, here is a dialogue with Sri Bhagavan and a questioner: D.: I do not understand what I should do.   
M: **If it is anything objective the way can be shown objectively. This   
is subjective.**   
D.: But I do not understand.   
M.: What! Do you not understand that you are?   
D.: Please tell me the way.   
M.: **Is it necessary to show the way in the interior of your own home?   
This is within you.**   
And here is another one   
D: "How to make the Quest, Who am I?   
M: " **The way is subjective, not objective; so it cannot and need not be  
shown by another**. Is it necessary to show anyone the way inside his own  
house? If the seeker keeps his mind still, that will be enough."   
Michael Langford however, gives atleast ten descriptions of his practice.

## Re:[18] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 22, 2010, 06:59:23 AM  
---  
Dear snow,   
I agree with you. The problem with commentators is that they   
vitiate the essence of original message of the Master. For example,   
take Sri Sankara. He said Advaitam, the One without a second.   
But his followers were trying to out-do Sri Sankara. Subsequently,   
as one may see in Panchadasi and other works, there are two schools under Sri  
Sankara, the Bamati School and the Bhatta School. One says that one will have  
still the sports of Maya veiling him, till he attains videha kaivalyam, that  
is leaving the body in liberated state. The other school says Maya stops the  
sports, once you kill the ego, which is only Maya-swarupam. Both have a set  
of arguments to support their views. The whole essence of Advaitam is lost in  
this lingual diarrohea of commentators. If one attains   
advaitic siddhi, one should stop commenting. If you start addressing someone  
as different from you, you accept duality.   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---

---  
Ongoing through the comments on Awareness Watching Awareness of Micheal  
Langford,doubts are expressed by members of this forum that awareness  
watching awareness cannot be the state of BEING.If the members go through  
the complete text of Mr.Langford, it will be clear that it is same as self  
enquiry.Mr. Micheal very clearly explains that Awareness watching awareness is  
nothing but turning our attention inwards.He has categorically mentioned that  
Awareness Watching awareness is Awareness Being Awareness   
He has clarified that because of long ancient habit of looking outwards  
towards people places and things,the word watching is used in practice  
instructions and that way we take the same habit of watching the people places  
and things and we shut our eyes and turn inwards.That is why the word watching  
is used.   
My question to devotees is that whether any of the member is able to turn his  
attention inwards without effort.As for i am concerned, I am not able to turn  
my attention inwards with out effort and the moment effort is lost,  
immediately mind turns outwards.The effort is put by Ego and not by Self and  
when ego comes in, then the thinker comes into play and so the duality.When a  
question was put to bhagavan on Choiceless Awareness(effortless awareness)  
advocated by JK(which is same as state of being), Bhagavan replied that it is  
same as Summa Iru and if one can attain that state then it is fine.However  
Bhagavan says that due to age old vasanas, a person cannot attain Choiceless  
awareness without effort and hence continuous effort is   
required.Tamil being an ancient language any ideas can be expressed very  
clearly without any distortion in Tamil.Bhagavan has composed most of his  
works in Tamil.Once it is translated in other language especially english, due  
to want of proper words, the meaning gets distorted even though the author  
may like to give exact meaning.Watching also falls in that category.

Yes, i have read that. But as Michael Langford says, "the Awareness Watching  
Awareness Method is always to be done with the eyes closed."   
Where as Sri Bhagavan answer to the question whether eyes should be open or  
not like this: A: It may be done either way. The point is that the mind must be introverted  
and kept active in its pursuit. Sometimes   
it happens that when the eyes are closed the latent thoughts rush forth with  
great vigour. It may also be difficult to   
introvert the mind with the eyes open. It requires strength of mind to do so.  
The mind is contaminated when it takes in   
objects. Otherwise, it is pure. The main factor in dhyana is to keep the mind  
active in its own pursuit without taking in   
external impressions or thinking of other matters.   
And here is another quote: Question: Is it enough if I spend some time in the mornings and some time in  
the evenings for this atma-vichara? Or should I do it always, even when I am  
writing or walking?   
A: What is your real nature? Is it writing, walking or being? The one  
unalterable reality is being. Until you realize that state of pure being you  
should pursue the enquiry. If once you are established in it there will be no  
further worry.No one will enquire into the source of thoughts unless thoughts  
arise. So long as you think I am walking or I am writing, enquire who does  
it.

## Re:[24]TAT TVAM ASI  Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: srkudai             Date: June 24, 2010, 03:26:44 PM  
---  
Friends,   
 If we do not get "dogmatic", I think Awareness Watching awareness is just Self Inquiry. I do not understand why we have a problem with this method.   
After all, what the author is saying is: 1\. "You are Awareness" [Awareness is Brahman - SAT CHIT ANANDA, All  
Scriptures say this]   
2\. "turn away from the objects and put all attention on awareness" [Drop all  
objects and meditate on Brahman alone].   
3. "Rest in awareness" [Let the "I" remain with its source]   
I do not see any problem with this teaching. How many amongst us are really  
convinced that "I am Awareness" ?   
Why are we not convinced, if we are not? Ramana said it, Scriptures say it !   
This person, I am not aware of his actual life style, is just saying turn away  
from all objects and remain as Self.   
When a thought comes "I am hurt", revert attention to that which is aware of  
this. Though the wordings may sound different this is EXACTLY SELF INQUIRY.   
Observing awareness is not Self inquiry. But detaching from everything and  
remaining as Awareness is Summa Iru - JUST BE. Only problem will be mind will  
not allow it, it moves out. So the practice is to bring it back to the  
Awareness.   
Sitting meditation or sitting with closed eyes will be useful intially. But  
eventually it has to be 24 hours, eyes open or closed.   
Love!   
Silence

## Re:[27] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 25, 2010, 07:22:05 AM  
---  
Dear everyone,   
If one can take Awareness Wathing Awarness is Being Awareness,   
all problems do get solved.   
In another paragraph of the article of Michael Langford, I believe   
that he had said that there are 10 methods. This again poses   
problem. There is only one method, self attention or Summa irutthal. Being  
still.   
I checked up Michael James who has worked with Sri Sadhu Om,   
and who has thoroughly learnt Tamizh. He says about the   
practice and number of hours: 1\. There is no fixed time. One can keep regularity of say half an hour or 1  
hour per day. This may be increased in course of time.   
2\. During other times, one should do either work for his livelihood   
or necessity but not turn the mind outwards towards unwanted things., like  
watching the road, watching other people, watching   
useless programmes in TV or reading worthless books etc.,   
3. Regarding closed eyes and open eyes, Bhagavan Ramana said to Annamalai Swami that closing the eyes, would keep the mind free, without using the senses, and so the mind will be more vigorous   
in thinking about various things. It is like throwing a ball on a wall, by  
standing closer to the wall, the ball would bounce back more vigorously since  
the distance to be covered would be less. Keeping the eyes open, can at least  
tell you that you mind is going outwards and seeing things that are worthless.  
The mind plus   
open eyes is better controlled than the mind plus shut eyes.   
Arunachala Siva.

## Re:[17] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: snow                Date: June 21, 2010, 01:02:04 PM  
---  
I find there to be some contradictions between Sri Bhagavan's and Michael  
Langford's teachings. Michael Langford says that awareness watching awareness  
should be always done eyes shut, but Sri Bhagavan said that it is totally  
immaterial in Self-Enquiry and actually sometimes advised vichara to be done  
eyes open.   
Also, here is a dialogue with Sri Bhagavan and a questioner: D.: I do not understand what I should do.   
M: **If it is anything objective the way can be shown objectively. This   
is subjective.**   
D.: But I do not understand.   
M.: What! Do you not understand that you are?   
D.: Please tell me the way.   
M.: **Is it necessary to show the way in the interior of your own home?   
This is within you.**   
And here is another one   
D: "How to make the Quest, Who am I?   
M: " **The way is subjective, not objective; so it cannot and need not be  
shown by another**. Is it necessary to show anyone the way inside his own  
house? If the seeker keeps his mind still, that will be enough."   
Michael Langford however, gives atleast ten descriptions of his practice.

## Re:[18] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 22, 2010, 06:59:23 AM  
---  
Dear snow,   
I agree with you. The problem with commentators is that they   
vitiate the essence of original message of the Master. For example,   
take Sri Sankara. He said Advaitam, the One without a second.   
But his followers were trying to out-do Sri Sankara. Subsequently,   
as one may see in Panchadasi and other works, there are two schools under Sri  
Sankara, the Bamati School and the Bhatta School. One says that one will have  
still the sports of Maya veiling him, till he attains videha kaivalyam, that  
is leaving the body in liberated state. The other school says Maya stops the  
sports, once you kill the ego, which is only Maya-swarupam. Both have a set  
of arguments to support their views. The whole essence of Advaitam is lost in  
this lingual diarrohea of commentators. If one attains   
advaitic siddhi, one should stop commenting. If you start addressing someone  
as different from you, you accept duality.   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100707015809/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg15986](http://web.archive.org/web/20100707015809/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg15986)

Author: viswanathan         Date: June 22, 2010, 12:25:43 PM  
---  
Ongoing through the comments on Awareness Watching Awareness of Micheal  
Langford,doubts are expressed by members of this forum that awareness  
watching awareness cannot be the state of BEING.If the members go through  
the complete text of Mr.Langford, it will be clear that it is same as self  
enquiry.Mr. Micheal very clearly explains that Awareness watching awareness is  
nothing but turning our attention inwards.He has categorically mentioned that  
Awareness Watching awareness is Awareness Being Awareness   
He has clarified that because of long ancient habit of looking outwards  
towards people places and things,the word watching is used in practice  
instructions and that way we take the same habit of watching the people places  
and things and we shut our eyes and turn inwards.That is why the word watching  
is used.   
My question to devotees is that whether any of the member is able to turn his  
attention inwards without effort.As for i am concerned, I am not able to turn  
my attention inwards with out effort and the moment effort is lost,  
immediately mind turns outwards.The effort is put by Ego and not by Self and  
when ego comes in, then the thinker comes into play and so the duality.When a  
question was put to bhagavan on Choiceless Awareness(effortless awareness)  
advocated by JK(which is same as state of being), Bhagavan replied that it is  
same as Summa Iru and if one can attain that state then it is fine.However  
Bhagavan says that due to age old vasanas, a person cannot attain Choiceless  
awareness without effort and hence continuous effort is   
required.Tamil being an ancient language any ideas can be expressed very  
clearly without any distortion in Tamil.Bhagavan has composed most of his  
works in Tamil.Once it is translated in other language especially english, due  
to want of proper words, the meaning gets distorted even though the author  
may like to give exact meaning.Watching also falls in that category.

Dear Mr.Snow,   
With reference to your post as above, i reproduce below in italics from  
Mr.Langford's article from the web site <http://www.dosisnet.de/awa.pd>as wrt  
to duration of practice. _To change this long habit of looking outward you

Yes, i have read that. But as Michael Langford says, "the Awareness Watching  
Awareness Method is always to be done with the eyes closed."   
Where as Sri Bhagavan answer to the question whether eyes should be open or  
not like this: A: It may be done either way. The point is that the mind must be introverted  
and kept active in its pursuit. Sometimes   
it happens that when the eyes are closed the latent thoughts rush forth with  
great vigour. It may also be difficult to   
introvert the mind with the eyes open. It requires strength of mind to do so.  
The mind is contaminated when it takes in   
objects. Otherwise, it is pure. The main factor in dhyana is to keep the mind  
active in its own pursuit without taking in   
external impressions or thinking of other matters.   
And here is another quote: Question: Is it enough if I spend some time in the mornings and some time in  
the evenings for this atma-vichara? Or should I do it always, even when I am  
writing or walking?   
A: What is your real nature? Is it writing, walking or being? The one  
unalterable reality is being. Until you realize that state of pure being you  
should pursue the enquiry. If once you are established in it there will be no  
further worry.No one will enquire into the source of thoughts unless thoughts  
arise. So long as you think I am walking or I am writing, enquire who does  
it.

## Re:[24]TAT TVAM ASI  Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: srkudai             Date: June 24, 2010, 03:26:44 PM  
---  
Friends,   
 If we do not get "dogmatic", I think Awareness Watching awareness is just Self Inquiry. I do not understand why we have a problem with this method.   
After all, what the author is saying is: 1\. "You are Awareness" [Awareness is Brahman - SAT CHIT ANANDA, All  
Scriptures say this]   
2\. "turn away from the objects and put all attention on awareness" [Drop all  
objects and meditate on Brahman alone].   
3. "Rest in awareness" [Let the "I" remain with its source]   
I do not see any problem with this teaching. How many amongst us are really  
convinced that "I am Awareness" ?   
Why are we not convinced, if we are not? Ramana said it, Scriptures say it !   
This person, I am not aware of his actual life style, is just saying turn away  
from all objects and remain as Self.   
When a thought comes "I am hurt", revert attention to that which is aware of  
this. Though the wordings may sound different this is EXACTLY SELF INQUIRY.   
Observing awareness is not Self inquiry. But detaching from everything and  
remaining as Awareness is Summa Iru - JUST BE. Only problem will be mind will  
not allow it, it moves out. So the practice is to bring it back to the  
Awareness.   
Sitting meditation or sitting with closed eyes will be useful intially. But  
eventually it has to be 24 hours, eyes open or closed.   
Love!   
Silence

## Re:[27] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 25, 2010, 07:22:05 AM  
---  
Dear everyone,   
If one can take Awareness Wathing Awarness is Being Awareness,   
all problems do get solved.   
In another paragraph of the article of Michael Langford, I believe   
that he had said that there are 10 methods. This again poses   
problem. There is only one method, self attention or Summa irutthal. Being  
still.   
I checked up Michael James who has worked with Sri Sadhu Om,   
and who has thoroughly learnt Tamizh. He says about the   
practice and number of hours: 1\. There is no fixed time. One can keep regularity of say half an hour or 1  
hour per day. This may be increased in course of time.   
2\. During other times, one should do either work for his livelihood   
or necessity but not turn the mind outwards towards unwanted things., like  
watching the road, watching other people, watching   
useless programmes in TV or reading worthless books etc.,   
3. Regarding closed eyes and open eyes, Bhagavan Ramana said to Annamalai Swami that closing the eyes, would keep the mind free, without using the senses, and so the mind will be more vigorous   
in thinking about various things. It is like throwing a ball on a wall, by  
standing closer to the wall, the ball would bounce back more vigorously since  
the distance to be covered would be less. Keeping the eyes open, can at least  
tell you that you mind is going outwards and seeing things that are worthless.  
The mind plus   
open eyes is better controlled than the mind plus shut eyes.   
Arunachala Siva.

## Re:[29] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 26, 2010, 11:26:31 AM  
---  
Dear srkudai,   
Muruganar says in Padamalai Verse 2399: Through His gentle smile, radiant Padam joyfully declares: "Why   
this distress? Be happy by just REMAINING till".   
This can also be viewed in the context of the following from   
Maharshi's Gospel: Bhagavan: Your duty is to be, and not to be this or that. 'I am   
that I am' sums up the whole truth. THE METHOD IS SUMMARIZED IN 'BE STILL'.   
And what does stillness mean? It means 'destroy yourself', because, every  
name and form is the cause of trouble. 'I-I' is   
the Self. 'I am this' is the ego. When the 'I' is kept up as the   
'I' only, it is the Self. When it flies off at a tangent and says,   
'I am this or that', I am such and such', it is the ego.   
Verse 1217: Since becoming established in the state of the Self is both the  
means and the goal to be attained, remain still.   
Talks No. 322 is as under:-   
Question: What should one do in order to remain free from thoughts as advised  
by you? Is it only enquiry 'Who am I?'   
Bhagavan: Only to remain still. Do it and see.   
Question: It is impossible.   
Bhagavan: Exactly. For the same reason, the enquiry 'Who am I?' is advised.   
Verse 2328: The wonderful meaning of the supreme world [summa iru] is to know  
and rest in the Atma Swarupa through the enquriy   
'Who am I?'   
Verse 2114: Except by remaining still [summa iruttal] by what great tapas can  
the Atma Swarupam be attained in the Heart?   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100707015809/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg15986](http://web.archive.org/web/20100707015809/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg15986)

to duration of practice. _To change this long habit of looking outward you

Yes, i have read that. But as Michael Langford says, "the Awareness Watching  
Awareness Method is always to be done with the eyes closed."   
Where as Sri Bhagavan answer to the question whether eyes should be open or  
not like this: A: It may be done either way. The point is that the mind must be introverted  
and kept active in its pursuit. Sometimes   
it happens that when the eyes are closed the latent thoughts rush forth with  
great vigour. It may also be difficult to   
introvert the mind with the eyes open. It requires strength of mind to do so.  
The mind is contaminated when it takes in   
objects. Otherwise, it is pure. The main factor in dhyana is to keep the mind  
active in its own pursuit without taking in   
external impressions or thinking of other matters.   
And here is another quote: Question: Is it enough if I spend some time in the mornings and some time in  
the evenings for this atma-vichara? Or should I do it always, even when I am  
writing or walking?   
A: What is your real nature? Is it writing, walking or being? The one  
unalterable reality is being. Until you realize that state of pure being you  
should pursue the enquiry. If once you are established in it there will be no  
further worry.No one will enquire into the source of thoughts unless thoughts  
arise. So long as you think I am walking or I am writing, enquire who does  
it.

Author: srkudai             Date: June 24, 2010, 03:26:44 PM

Friends,   
 If we do not get "dogmatic", I think Awareness Watching awareness is just Self Inquiry. I do not understand why we have a problem with this method.   
After all, what the author is saying is: 1\. "You are Awareness" [Awareness is Brahman - SAT CHIT ANANDA, All  
Scriptures say this]   
2\. "turn away from the objects and put all attention on awareness" [Drop all  
objects and meditate on Brahman alone].   
3. "Rest in awareness" [Let the "I" remain with its source]   
I do not see any problem with this teaching. How many amongst us are really  
convinced that "I am Awareness" ?   
Why are we not convinced, if we are not? Ramana said it, Scriptures say it !   
This person, I am not aware of his actual life style, is just saying turn away  
from all objects and remain as Self.   
When a thought comes "I am hurt", revert attention to that which is aware of  
this. Though the wordings may sound different this is EXACTLY SELF INQUIRY.   
Observing awareness is not Self inquiry. But detaching from everything and  
remaining as Awareness is Summa Iru - JUST BE. Only problem will be mind will  
not allow it, it moves out. So the practice is to bring it back to the  
Awareness.   
Sitting meditation or sitting with closed eyes will be useful intially. But  
eventually it has to be 24 hours, eyes open or closed.   
Love!   
Silence

## Re:[27] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 25, 2010, 07:22:05 AM  
---  
Dear everyone,   
If one can take Awareness Wathing Awarness is Being Awareness,   
all problems do get solved.   
In another paragraph of the article of Michael Langford, I believe   
that he had said that there are 10 methods. This again poses   
problem. There is only one method, self attention or Summa irutthal. Being  
still.   
I checked up Michael James who has worked with Sri Sadhu Om,   
and who has thoroughly learnt Tamizh. He says about the   
practice and number of hours: 1\. There is no fixed time. One can keep regularity of say half an hour or 1  
hour per day. This may be increased in course of time.   
2\. During other times, one should do either work for his livelihood   
or necessity but not turn the mind outwards towards unwanted things., like  
watching the road, watching other people, watching   
useless programmes in TV or reading worthless books etc.,   
3. Regarding closed eyes and open eyes, Bhagavan Ramana said to Annamalai Swami that closing the eyes, would keep the mind free, without using the senses, and so the mind will be more vigorous   
in thinking about various things. It is like throwing a ball on a wall, by  
standing closer to the wall, the ball would bounce back more vigorously since  
the distance to be covered would be less. Keeping the eyes open, can at least  
tell you that you mind is going outwards and seeing things that are worthless.  
The mind plus   
open eyes is better controlled than the mind plus shut eyes.   
Arunachala Siva.

## Re:[29] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 26, 2010, 11:26:31 AM  
---  
Dear srkudai,   
Muruganar says in Padamalai Verse 2399: Through His gentle smile, radiant Padam joyfully declares: "Why   
this distress? Be happy by just REMAINING till".   
This can also be viewed in the context of the following from   
Maharshi's Gospel: Bhagavan: Your duty is to be, and not to be this or that. 'I am   
that I am' sums up the whole truth. THE METHOD IS SUMMARIZED IN 'BE STILL'.   
And what does stillness mean? It means 'destroy yourself', because, every  
name and form is the cause of trouble. 'I-I' is   
the Self. 'I am this' is the ego. When the 'I' is kept up as the   
'I' only, it is the Self. When it flies off at a tangent and says,   
'I am this or that', I am such and such', it is the ego.   
Verse 1217: Since becoming established in the state of the Self is both the  
means and the goal to be attained, remain still.   
Talks No. 322 is as under:-   
Question: What should one do in order to remain free from thoughts as advised  
by you? Is it only enquiry 'Who am I?'   
Bhagavan: Only to remain still. Do it and see.   
Question: It is impossible.   
Bhagavan: Exactly. For the same reason, the enquiry 'Who am I?' is advised.   
Verse 2328: The wonderful meaning of the supreme world [summa iru] is to know  
and rest in the Atma Swarupa through the enquriy   
'Who am I?'   
Verse 2114: Except by remaining still [summa iruttal] by what great tapas can  
the Atma Swarupam be attained in the Heart?   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100707015658/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg15993](http://web.archive.org/web/20100707015658/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg15993)

## Re:[17] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: snow                Date: June 21, 2010, 01:02:04 PM  
---  
I find there to be some contradictions between Sri Bhagavan's and Michael  
Langford's teachings. Michael Langford says that awareness watching awareness  
should be always done eyes shut, but Sri Bhagavan said that it is totally  
immaterial in Self-Enquiry and actually sometimes advised vichara to be done  
eyes open.   
Also, here is a dialogue with Sri Bhagavan and a questioner: D.: I do not understand what I should do.   
M: **If it is anything objective the way can be shown objectively. This   
is subjective.**   
D.: But I do not understand.   
M.: What! Do you not understand that you are?   
D.: Please tell me the way.   
M.: **Is it necessary to show the way in the interior of your own home?   
This is within you.**   
And here is another one   
D: "How to make the Quest, Who am I?   
M: " **The way is subjective, not objective; so it cannot and need not be  
shown by another**. Is it necessary to show anyone the way inside his own  
house? If the seeker keeps his mind still, that will be enough."   
Michael Langford however, gives atleast ten descriptions of his practice.

## Re:[18] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 22, 2010, 06:59:23 AM  
---  
Dear snow,   
I agree with you. The problem with commentators is that they   
vitiate the essence of original message of the Master. For example,   
take Sri Sankara. He said Advaitam, the One without a second.   
But his followers were trying to out-do Sri Sankara. Subsequently,   
as one may see in Panchadasi and other works, there are two schools under Sri  
Sankara, the Bamati School and the Bhatta School. One says that one will have  
still the sports of Maya veiling him, till he attains videha kaivalyam, that  
is leaving the body in liberated state. The other school says Maya stops the  
sports, once you kill the ego, which is only Maya-swarupam. Both have a set  
of arguments to support their views. The whole essence of Advaitam is lost in  
this lingual diarrohea of commentators. If one attains   
advaitic siddhi, one should stop commenting. If you start addressing someone  
as different from you, you accept duality.   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100707020113/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16027](http://web.archive.org/web/20100707020113/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16027)

## Re:[19] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: viswanathan         Date: June 22, 2010, 12:25:43 PM  
---  
Ongoing through the comments on Awareness Watching Awareness of Micheal  
Langford,doubts are expressed by members of this forum that awareness  
watching awareness cannot be the state of BEING.If the members go through  
the complete text of Mr.Langford, it will be clear that it is same as self  
enquiry.Mr. Micheal very clearly explains that Awareness watching awareness is  
nothing but turning our attention inwards.He has categorically mentioned that  
Awareness Watching awareness is Awareness Being Awareness   
He has clarified that because of long ancient habit of looking outwards  
towards people places and things,the word watching is used in practice  
instructions and that way we take the same habit of watching the people places  
and things and we shut our eyes and turn inwards.That is why the word watching  
is used.   
My question to devotees is that whether any of the member is able to turn his  
attention inwards without effort.As for i am concerned, I am not able to turn  
my attention inwards with out effort and the moment effort is lost,  
immediately mind turns outwards.The effort is put by Ego and not by Self and  
when ego comes in, then the thinker comes into play and so the duality.When a  
question was put to bhagavan on Choiceless Awareness(effortless awareness)  
advocated by JK(which is same as state of being), Bhagavan replied that it is  
same as Summa Iru and if one can attain that state then it is fine.However  
Bhagavan says that due to age old vasanas, a person cannot attain Choiceless  
awareness without effort and hence continuous effort is   
required.Tamil being an ancient language any ideas can be expressed very  
clearly without any distortion in Tamil.Bhagavan has composed most of his  
works in Tamil.Once it is translated in other language especially english, due  
to want of proper words, the meaning gets distorted even though the author  
may like to give exact meaning.Watching also falls in that category.

Friends,   
 If we do not get "dogmatic", I think Awareness Watching awareness is just Self Inquiry. I do not understand why we have a problem with this method.   
After all, what the author is saying is: 1\. "You are Awareness" [Awareness is Brahman - SAT CHIT ANANDA, All  
Scriptures say this]   
2\. "turn away from the objects and put all attention on awareness" [Drop all  
objects and meditate on Brahman alone].   
3. "Rest in awareness" [Let the "I" remain with its source]   
I do not see any problem with this teaching. How many amongst us are really  
convinced that "I am Awareness" ?   
Why are we not convinced, if we are not? Ramana said it, Scriptures say it !   
This person, I am not aware of his actual life style, is just saying turn away  
from all objects and remain as Self.   
When a thought comes "I am hurt", revert attention to that which is aware of  
this. Though the wordings may sound different this is EXACTLY SELF INQUIRY.   
Observing awareness is not Self inquiry. But detaching from everything and  
remaining as Awareness is Summa Iru - JUST BE. Only problem will be mind will  
not allow it, it moves out. So the practice is to bring it back to the  
Awareness.   
Sitting meditation or sitting with closed eyes will be useful intially. But  
eventually it has to be 24 hours, eyes open or closed.   
Love!   
Silence

Dear Mr.Snow,

When you keep the eyes open, not only the thought of objects seen by eye comes up in mind and disturbs u,but also thought of past and future comes up in mind. if you close your eyes, only thoughts of past and future will haunt you..So it is better to keep eyes closed instead open so that you have only one distraction instead of two..May be that a very advanced sadhaka will be able to meditate with eyes open but I have not so far seen in meditation hall of Ramanasramam any serious and sincere sadhaka meditating with eyes open.For that matter majority of peoplemeditate with eyes closed.That is the reason Mr.Langford has suggested to close the eyes.Bhagavan himself has told that what is important is to turn our attention inwards and it does not matter whether the eye is open or closed during meditation.

---  
Dear everyone,   
If one can take Awareness Wathing Awarness is Being Awareness,   
all problems do get solved.   
In another paragraph of the article of Michael Langford, I believe   
that he had said that there are 10 methods. This again poses   
problem. There is only one method, self attention or Summa irutthal. Being  
still.   
I checked up Michael James who has worked with Sri Sadhu Om,   
and who has thoroughly learnt Tamizh. He says about the   
practice and number of hours: 1\. There is no fixed time. One can keep regularity of say half an hour or 1  
hour per day. This may be increased in course of time.   
2\. During other times, one should do either work for his livelihood   
or necessity but not turn the mind outwards towards unwanted things., like  
watching the road, watching other people, watching   
useless programmes in TV or reading worthless books etc.,   
3. Regarding closed eyes and open eyes, Bhagavan Ramana said to Annamalai Swami that closing the eyes, would keep the mind free, without using the senses, and so the mind will be more vigorous   
in thinking about various things. It is like throwing a ball on a wall, by  
standing closer to the wall, the ball would bounce back more vigorously since  
the distance to be covered would be less. Keeping the eyes open, can at least  
tell you that you mind is going outwards and seeing things that are worthless.  
The mind plus   
open eyes is better controlled than the mind plus shut eyes.   
Arunachala Siva.

## Re:[29] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 26, 2010, 11:26:31 AM  
---  
Dear srkudai,   
Muruganar says in Padamalai Verse 2399: Through His gentle smile, radiant Padam joyfully declares: "Why   
this distress? Be happy by just REMAINING till".   
This can also be viewed in the context of the following from   
Maharshi's Gospel: Bhagavan: Your duty is to be, and not to be this or that. 'I am   
that I am' sums up the whole truth. THE METHOD IS SUMMARIZED IN 'BE STILL'.   
And what does stillness mean? It means 'destroy yourself', because, every  
name and form is the cause of trouble. 'I-I' is   
the Self. 'I am this' is the ego. When the 'I' is kept up as the   
'I' only, it is the Self. When it flies off at a tangent and says,   
'I am this or that', I am such and such', it is the ego.   
Verse 1217: Since becoming established in the state of the Self is both the  
means and the goal to be attained, remain still.   
Talks No. 322 is as under:-   
Question: What should one do in order to remain free from thoughts as advised  
by you? Is it only enquiry 'Who am I?'   
Bhagavan: Only to remain still. Do it and see.   
Question: It is impossible.   
Bhagavan: Exactly. For the same reason, the enquiry 'Who am I?' is advised.   
Verse 2328: The wonderful meaning of the supreme world [summa iru] is to know  
and rest in the Atma Swarupa through the enquriy   
'Who am I?'   
Verse 2114: Except by remaining still [summa iruttal] by what great tapas can  
the Atma Swarupam be attained in the Heart?   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---

I find there to be some contradictions between Sri Bhagavan's and Michael  
Langford's teachings. Michael Langford says that awareness watching awareness  
should be always done eyes shut, but Sri Bhagavan said that it is totally  
immaterial in Self-Enquiry and actually sometimes advised vichara to be done  
eyes open.   
Also, here is a dialogue with Sri Bhagavan and a questioner: D.: I do not understand what I should do.   
M: **If it is anything objective the way can be shown objectively. This   
is subjective.**   
D.: But I do not understand.   
M.: What! Do you not understand that you are?   
D.: Please tell me the way.   
M.: **Is it necessary to show the way in the interior of your own home?   
This is within you.**   
And here is another one   
D: "How to make the Quest, Who am I?   
M: " **The way is subjective, not objective; so it cannot and need not be  
shown by another**. Is it necessary to show anyone the way inside his own  
house? If the seeker keeps his mind still, that will be enough."   
Michael Langford however, gives atleast ten descriptions of his practice.

## Re:[18] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 22, 2010, 06:59:23 AM  
---  
Dear snow,   
I agree with you. The problem with commentators is that they   
vitiate the essence of original message of the Master. For example,   
take Sri Sankara. He said Advaitam, the One without a second.   
But his followers were trying to out-do Sri Sankara. Subsequently,   
as one may see in Panchadasi and other works, there are two schools under Sri  
Sankara, the Bamati School and the Bhatta School. One says that one will have  
still the sports of Maya veiling him, till he attains videha kaivalyam, that  
is leaving the body in liberated state. The other school says Maya stops the  
sports, once you kill the ego, which is only Maya-swarupam. Both have a set  
of arguments to support their views. The whole essence of Advaitam is lost in  
this lingual diarrohea of commentators. If one attains   
advaitic siddhi, one should stop commenting. If you start addressing someone  
as different from you, you accept duality.   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---

watching awareness cannot be the state of BEING.If the members go through  
the complete text of Mr.Langford, it will be clear that it is same as self  
enquiry.Mr. Micheal very clearly explains that Awareness watching awareness is  
nothing but turning our attention inwards.He has categorically mentioned that  
Awareness Watching awareness is Awareness Being Awareness   
He has clarified that because of long ancient habit of looking outwards  
towards people places and things,the word watching is used in practice  
instructions and that way we take the same habit of watching the people places  
and things and we shut our eyes and turn inwards.That is why the word watching  
is used.   
My question to devotees is that whether any of the member is able to turn his  
attention inwards without effort.As for i am concerned, I am not able to turn  
my attention inwards with out effort and the moment effort is lost,  
immediately mind turns outwards.The effort is put by Ego and not by Self and  
when ego comes in, then the thinker comes into play and so the duality.When a  
question was put to bhagavan on Choiceless Awareness(effortless awareness)  
advocated by JK(which is same as state of being), Bhagavan replied that it is  
same as Summa Iru and if one can attain that state then it is fine.However  
Bhagavan says that due to age old vasanas, a person cannot attain Choiceless  
awareness without effort and hence continuous effort is   
required.Tamil being an ancient language any ideas can be expressed very  
clearly without any distortion in Tamil.Bhagavan has composed most of his  
works in Tamil.Once it is translated in other language especially english, due  
to want of proper words, the meaning gets distorted even though the author  
may like to give exact meaning.Watching also falls in that category.

writing or walking?

unalterable reality is being. Until you realize that state of pure being you  
should pursue the enquiry. If once you are established in it there will be no  
further worry.No one will enquire into the source of thoughts unless thoughts  
arise. So long as you think I am walking or I am writing, enquire who does  
it.

problem. There is only one method, self attention or Summa irutthal. Being  
still.   
I checked up Michael James who has worked with Sri Sadhu Om,   
and who has thoroughly learnt Tamizh. He says about the   
practice and number of hours: 1\. There is no fixed time. One can keep regularity of say half an hour or 1  
hour per day. This may be increased in course of time.   
2\. During other times, one should do either work for his livelihood   
or necessity but not turn the mind outwards towards unwanted things., like  
watching the road, watching other people, watching   
useless programmes in TV or reading worthless books etc.,   
3. Regarding closed eyes and open eyes, Bhagavan Ramana said to Annamalai Swami that closing the eyes, would keep the mind free, without using the senses, and so the mind will be more vigorous   
in thinking about various things. It is like throwing a ball on a wall, by  
standing closer to the wall, the ball would bounce back more vigorously since  
the distance to be covered would be less. Keeping the eyes open, can at least  
tell you that you mind is going outwards and seeing things that are worthless.  
The mind plus   
open eyes is better controlled than the mind plus shut eyes.   
Arunachala Siva.

## Re:[29] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 26, 2010, 11:26:31 AM  
---  
Dear srkudai,   
Muruganar says in Padamalai Verse 2399: Through His gentle smile, radiant Padam joyfully declares: "Why   
this distress? Be happy by just REMAINING till".   
This can also be viewed in the context of the following from   
Maharshi's Gospel: Bhagavan: Your duty is to be, and not to be this or that. 'I am   
that I am' sums up the whole truth. THE METHOD IS SUMMARIZED IN 'BE STILL'.   
And what does stillness mean? It means 'destroy yourself', because, every  
name and form is the cause of trouble. 'I-I' is   
the Self. 'I am this' is the ego. When the 'I' is kept up as the   
'I' only, it is the Self. When it flies off at a tangent and says,   
'I am this or that', I am such and such', it is the ego.   
Verse 1217: Since becoming established in the state of the Self is both the  
means and the goal to be attained, remain still.   
Talks No. 322 is as under:-   
Question: What should one do in order to remain free from thoughts as advised  
by you? Is it only enquiry 'Who am I?'   
Bhagavan: Only to remain still. Do it and see.   
Question: It is impossible.   
Bhagavan: Exactly. For the same reason, the enquiry 'Who am I?' is advised.   
Verse 2328: The wonderful meaning of the supreme world [summa iru] is to know  
and rest in the Atma Swarupa through the enquriy   
'Who am I?'   
Verse 2114: Except by remaining still [summa iruttal] by what great tapas can  
the Atma Swarupam be attained in the Heart?   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---

## Re:[17] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: snow                Date: June 21, 2010, 01:02:04 PM  
---  
I find there to be some contradictions between Sri Bhagavan's and Michael  
Langford's teachings. Michael Langford says that awareness watching awareness  
should be always done eyes shut, but Sri Bhagavan said that it is totally  
immaterial in Self-Enquiry and actually sometimes advised vichara to be done  
eyes open.   
Also, here is a dialogue with Sri Bhagavan and a questioner: D.: I do not understand what I should do.   
M: **If it is anything objective the way can be shown objectively. This   
is subjective.**   
D.: But I do not understand.   
M.: What! Do you not understand that you are?   
D.: Please tell me the way.   
M.: **Is it necessary to show the way in the interior of your own home?   
This is within you.**   
And here is another one   
D: "How to make the Quest, Who am I?   
M: " **The way is subjective, not objective; so it cannot and need not be  
shown by another**. Is it necessary to show anyone the way inside his own  
house? If the seeker keeps his mind still, that will be enough."   
Michael Langford however, gives atleast ten descriptions of his practice.

## Re:[18] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 22, 2010, 06:59:23 AM  
---  
Dear snow,   
I agree with you. The problem with commentators is that they   
vitiate the essence of original message of the Master. For example,   
take Sri Sankara. He said Advaitam, the One without a second.   
But his followers were trying to out-do Sri Sankara. Subsequently,   
as one may see in Panchadasi and other works, there are two schools under Sri  
Sankara, the Bamati School and the Bhatta School. One says that one will have  
still the sports of Maya veiling him, till he attains videha kaivalyam, that  
is leaving the body in liberated state. The other school says Maya stops the  
sports, once you kill the ego, which is only Maya-swarupam. Both have a set  
of arguments to support their views. The whole essence of Advaitam is lost in  
this lingual diarrohea of commentators. If one attains   
advaitic siddhi, one should stop commenting. If you start addressing someone  
as different from you, you accept duality.   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---

Ongoing through the comments on Awareness Watching Awareness of Micheal  
Langford,doubts are expressed by members of this forum that awareness  
watching awareness cannot be the state of BEING.If the members go through  
the complete text of Mr.Langford, it will be clear that it is same as self  
enquiry.Mr. Micheal very clearly explains that Awareness watching awareness is  
nothing but turning our attention inwards.He has categorically mentioned that  
Awareness Watching awareness is Awareness Being Awareness   
He has clarified that because of long ancient habit of looking outwards  
towards people places and things,the word watching is used in practice  
instructions and that way we take the same habit of watching the people places  
and things and we shut our eyes and turn inwards.That is why the word watching  
is used.   
My question to devotees is that whether any of the member is able to turn his  
attention inwards without effort.As for i am concerned, I am not able to turn  
my attention inwards with out effort and the moment effort is lost,  
immediately mind turns outwards.The effort is put by Ego and not by Self and  
when ego comes in, then the thinker comes into play and so the duality.When a  
question was put to bhagavan on Choiceless Awareness(effortless awareness)  
advocated by JK(which is same as state of being), Bhagavan replied that it is  
same as Summa Iru and if one can attain that state then it is fine.However  
Bhagavan says that due to age old vasanas, a person cannot attain Choiceless  
awareness without effort and hence continuous effort is   
required.Tamil being an ancient language any ideas can be expressed very  
clearly without any distortion in Tamil.Bhagavan has composed most of his  
works in Tamil.Once it is translated in other language especially english, due  
to want of proper words, the meaning gets distorted even though the author  
may like to give exact meaning.Watching also falls in that category.

Yes, i have read that. But as Michael Langford says, "the Awareness Watching  
Awareness Method is always to be done with the eyes closed."   
Where as Sri Bhagavan answer to the question whether eyes should be open or  
not like this: A: It may be done either way. The point is that the mind must be introverted  
and kept active in its pursuit. Sometimes   
it happens that when the eyes are closed the latent thoughts rush forth with  
great vigour. It may also be difficult to   
introvert the mind with the eyes open. It requires strength of mind to do so.  
The mind is contaminated when it takes in   
objects. Otherwise, it is pure. The main factor in dhyana is to keep the mind  
active in its own pursuit without taking in   
external impressions or thinking of other matters.   
And here is another quote: Question: Is it enough if I spend some time in the mornings and some time in  
the evenings for this atma-vichara? Or should I do it always, even when I am  
writing or walking?   
A: What is your real nature? Is it writing, walking or being? The one  
unalterable reality is being. Until you realize that state of pure being you  
should pursue the enquiry. If once you are established in it there will be no  
further worry.No one will enquire into the source of thoughts unless thoughts  
arise. So long as you think I am walking or I am writing, enquire who does  
it.

## Re:[24]TAT TVAM ASI  Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: srkudai             Date: June 24, 2010, 03:26:44 PM

Friends,   
 If we do not get "dogmatic", I think Awareness Watching awareness is just Self Inquiry. I do not understand why we have a problem with this method.   
After all, what the author is saying is: 1\. "You are Awareness" [Awareness is Brahman - SAT CHIT ANANDA, All  
Scriptures say this]   
2\. "turn away from the objects and put all attention on awareness" [Drop all  
objects and meditate on Brahman alone].   
3. "Rest in awareness" [Let the "I" remain with its source]   
I do not see any problem with this teaching. How many amongst us are really  
convinced that "I am Awareness" ?   
Why are we not convinced, if we are not? Ramana said it, Scriptures say it !   
This person, I am not aware of his actual life style, is just saying turn away  
from all objects and remain as Self.   
When a thought comes "I am hurt", revert attention to that which is aware of  
this. Though the wordings may sound different this is EXACTLY SELF INQUIRY.   
Observing awareness is not Self inquiry. But detaching from everything and  
remaining as Awareness is Summa Iru - JUST BE. Only problem will be mind will  
not allow it, it moves out. So the practice is to bring it back to the  
Awareness.   
Sitting meditation or sitting with closed eyes will be useful intially. But  
eventually it has to be 24 hours, eyes open or closed.   
Love!   
Silence

## Re:[17] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: snow                Date: June 21, 2010, 01:02:04 PM  
---  
I find there to be some contradictions between Sri Bhagavan's and Michael  
Langford's teachings. Michael Langford says that awareness watching awareness  
should be always done eyes shut, but Sri Bhagavan said that it is totally  
immaterial in Self-Enquiry and actually sometimes advised vichara to be done  
eyes open.   
Also, here is a dialogue with Sri Bhagavan and a questioner: D.: I do not understand what I should do.   
M: **If it is anything objective the way can be shown objectively. This   
is subjective.**   
D.: But I do not understand.   
M.: What! Do you not understand that you are?   
D.: Please tell me the way.   
M.: **Is it necessary to show the way in the interior of your own home?   
This is within you.**   
And here is another one   
D: "How to make the Quest, Who am I?   
M: " **The way is subjective, not objective; so it cannot and need not be  
shown by another**. Is it necessary to show anyone the way inside his own  
house? If the seeker keeps his mind still, that will be enough."   
Michael Langford however, gives atleast ten descriptions of his practice.

## Re:[18] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 22, 2010, 06:59:23 AM  
---  
Dear snow,   
I agree with you. The problem with commentators is that they   
vitiate the essence of original message of the Master. For example,   
take Sri Sankara. He said Advaitam, the One without a second.   
But his followers were trying to out-do Sri Sankara. Subsequently,   
as one may see in Panchadasi and other works, there are two schools under Sri  
Sankara, the Bamati School and the Bhatta School. One says that one will have  
still the sports of Maya veiling him, till he attains videha kaivalyam, that  
is leaving the body in liberated state. The other school says Maya stops the  
sports, once you kill the ego, which is only Maya-swarupam. Both have a set  
of arguments to support their views. The whole essence of Advaitam is lost in  
this lingual diarrohea of commentators. If one attains   
advaitic siddhi, one should stop commenting. If you start addressing someone  
as different from you, you accept duality.   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---
