## Re:[57] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 07:40:29 AM  
---  
Dear I,   
Every thing that is being discussed is only a 'stand point' of view, which is  
only the mind's. It can never know the consciousness which is unlimited.  
whatever we try and say is only making it limited.   
A Jivan Mukta does not have a body, as consciousness, 'it' is pervaded  
everywhere and everything. No one has body. since it is projection of mind, it  
exists as sanke in rope.   
In the end, you speak from your perception and I speak from my perception.   
There is no your perception and my perception. You are talking to yourself and  
I am talking to myself. There is no You and I.   
Perception exists only for the mind. Perception is again just a projection. as  
long as the Mind exists, perception, projection, etc.. continues. When, Mano  
Naasam, all is naught.   
The games of your perception, my perception etc.. continue for the mind, is it  
not the projection of the mind?   
Quote  
we can only speak from our standpoint. A Jeevan muktha has body and a Videha  
muktha has no body.  
That everything is only the projection of the mind including the Jivanmukta  
and Videhamukta. When Mano Naasam, there is no Jivanmukta, no Videhamukta, No  
consciousness, no nothing or there is Jivanmukta, there is Videhamukta,  
Consciousness everywhere, Aatman, Brahman.   
These are all again the projections of mind.   
This mind as to merge. this is Mano naasam. As long as there are projections  
of any type, mind has not merged.   
Salutations to Sri Ramana
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100707040015/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16218](http://web.archive.org/web/20100707040015/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16218)

Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 28, 2010, 01:52:04 PM  
---  
Dear prasanth and others,   
The problem is that we are not able to visualize a state where the   
mind is killed. Mind-killing seems to be bothering most of us.   
If you substitute ego with mind, then, we are comfortable. Everyone   
agrees that one should kill the ego. Bhagavan Ramana also concludes   
ULLadu Narpadu by saying, Ahandhai uru azhitale mukti. The destruction of the  
ego is liberation. But Bhagavan Ramana uses   
the phrase mano-nasam in Who am I? He does not say Ahandai nasam. For that  
matter, He never uses the word Ahandai, ego   
in Who am I? directly. This is a poser for all of us! However, He gives one  
description about ahandai or ahankaram in Who am I? He says that "I-thought  
is the first thought from the mind. And this ahankaram."   
Arunachala Siva.

## Re:[53] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 06:47:40 AM  
---  
Dear I   
Quote from: srkudai on June 29, 2010, 07:54:26 AM  
When ego is burnt, still there is role playing, but one knows clearly that one  
is not ravana.   
why should an enlightened person not continue playing the role of Ravana,  
knowing pretty well that there is only Rama?   
Appearances are only projection of the mind, similarly, Ravana is a character  
projected by the mind. When the mind is merged into itself - Self, Ravana  
ceases to be, as there will be no mind for projection of Ravana.   
You have to remain as Rama (actually not even reamaing, you are 'that' Tat  
Tvam Asi), There is no way you can continue playing the role of Ravana, that  
implies that mind is still there.   
Once the mind is merged into Self, there will/should not be any appearances,  
i.e. no more any projections. There will only be Rama and Rama everywhere. No  
more roles, characters, etc...   
If it is so, that the Ravana role continues, and even if that role does not  
affect us as Rama, then still it is only projection of the Mind. Therefore  
Mind has still not merged.   
After enlightenment, realising that the cinema is not real, why do you still  
want to sit and watch the movie that is not there? movie still being continued  
- do you not think that still mind is there projecting the universe?   
Mind has to merge, this is Mano Naasam! which is - absolutely no projections  
at all and no continuing of movies or characters or is it even the  
enlightenment that the roles can continue and that it cannot affect you  
anymore.   
These are my humble views   
Salutations to Sri Ramana

Content:

## Re:[55] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 07:06:12 AM  
---  
A Jeevan Muktha is said to have had release from body and still exist in the  
body for **outsiders** like ourselves. It is Videha muktha what you are  
talking about.   
In Sadashiva Brahmendral, we have seen how his hands were chopped off and yet  
he continued to walk without even being aware of it. We all know how Ramana  
Maharshi had his tumor operated without even taking anesthesia.   
It only appears for outsiders like ourselves that a Jivanmukta has prarabdha,  
that they have body, etc.., but they do not have any prarabdha or body.   
Salutations to Sri Ramana

## Re:[57] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 07:40:29 AM  
---  
Dear I,   
Every thing that is being discussed is only a 'stand point' of view, which is  
only the mind's. It can never know the consciousness which is unlimited.  
whatever we try and say is only making it limited.   
A Jivan Mukta does not have a body, as consciousness, 'it' is pervaded  
everywhere and everything. No one has body. since it is projection of mind, it  
exists as sanke in rope.   
In the end, you speak from your perception and I speak from my perception.   
There is no your perception and my perception. You are talking to yourself and  
I am talking to myself. There is no You and I.   
Perception exists only for the mind. Perception is again just a projection. as  
long as the Mind exists, perception, projection, etc.. continues. When, Mano  
Naasam, all is naught.   
The games of your perception, my perception etc.. continue for the mind, is it  
not the projection of the mind?   
Quote  
we can only speak from our standpoint. A Jeevan muktha has body and a Videha  
muktha has no body.  
That everything is only the projection of the mind including the Jivanmukta  
and Videhamukta. When Mano Naasam, there is no Jivanmukta, no Videhamukta, No  
consciousness, no nothing or there is Jivanmukta, there is Videhamukta,  
Consciousness everywhere, Aatman, Brahman.   
These are all again the projections of mind.   
This mind as to merge. this is Mano naasam. As long as there are projections  
of any type, mind has not merged.   
Salutations to Sri Ramana
 ---

Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 28, 2010, 01:52:04 PM  
---  
Dear prasanth and others,   
The problem is that we are not able to visualize a state where the   
mind is killed. Mind-killing seems to be bothering most of us.   
If you substitute ego with mind, then, we are comfortable. Everyone   
agrees that one should kill the ego. Bhagavan Ramana also concludes   
ULLadu Narpadu by saying, Ahandhai uru azhitale mukti. The destruction of the  
ego is liberation. But Bhagavan Ramana uses   
the phrase mano-nasam in Who am I? He does not say Ahandai nasam. For that  
matter, He never uses the word Ahandai, ego   
in Who am I? directly. This is a poser for all of us! However, He gives one  
description about ahandai or ahankaram in Who am I? He says that "I-thought  
is the first thought from the mind. And this ahankaram."   
Arunachala Siva.

## Re:[51] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?

Quote from: Nagaraj on June 27, 2010, 01:17:46 PM  
Who am I is simply holding on to the 'I'. All the analysis are to be given  
absolutely no importance at all. one need not even learn all these  
intricacies. After all what is the real objective? is not to hold on to the  
'I'? its like, we forget the main dishes served in an plantain leaf and  
showing more interest in the "echils" \- food spilt down from our mouth.   
In the above quote,Mr.Nagaraj has introduced the word "Echils"-food split down  
from the mouth and i thought share some good and ad aspects of "Echil".. In  
tamil this word commonly refers to saliva which we spit..Also, any food left  
over in the plate by the eater is also called "Echils" and is considered  
impure and and unhygienic for others to eat. The people who eat left over  
food(Echils)are looked down in society and also sometimes ridiculed..However,  
it is a a common sight in marriages that the food left over on the plate  
will be thrown in dust bin and will be collected by poorest of poor  
especially gypsies(Narikoravas) to satisfy their hunger.Also the left over  
food thrown in dust bin will be shared by dogs and other animals who are not  
fortunate as us.. In the orthodox brahmin families it is still a practice  
wherein the husband will eat first and the plate will not be washed and will  
have some left over food and in the same plate wife will be served food and  
here the "Echils" is very much nourished by the wife taken as prasad from  
husband and that "Echil" is not considered as unhygienic..However the same  
parent will not approve their children sharing "Echils".During Bhagavan days,  
some of orthodox devotees will wait till Bhagavan finishes eating and when he  
leaves dining hall, they will rush to collect the "Echil"(food left in  
hagavan's plate) and eat it as Bhagavan's prasad. When Bhagavan came to know  
of this practice, he did not approve of this.There was a well known saint by  
name Poondi Swamiyar wherein devotees will eat the food tasted by Poondi  
Swamiar and here "Echil" was very considered as divine and was very much  
respected.In swami suddhananda's ashram, Swami used to advice devotees in  
dining hall to leave some food("Echils") in plate for the animals in the  
ashram.   
During last days of Sri.Ramakrishna Paramahamsha, he was suffering with  
Cancer which was in advanced state.His closest aides who were were serving him  
were afraid to go near him fearing that they will also contract cancer and  
left him.On seeing this, Swami Vivekananda took a glass of liquid and gave it  
to Sri ramakrishna to drink and then Swami Vivekananda drank the left  
over(Echil) in the glass.On seeing this, Sri Ramakrishna's close aides got  
over the fear of Contracting Cancer and started serving him again.

## Re:[57] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 07:40:29 AM  
---  
Dear I,   
Every thing that is being discussed is only a 'stand point' of view, which is  
only the mind's. It can never know the consciousness which is unlimited.  
whatever we try and say is only making it limited.   
A Jivan Mukta does not have a body, as consciousness, 'it' is pervaded  
everywhere and everything. No one has body. since it is projection of mind, it  
exists as sanke in rope.   
In the end, you speak from your perception and I speak from my perception.   
There is no your perception and my perception. You are talking to yourself and  
I am talking to myself. There is no You and I.   
Perception exists only for the mind. Perception is again just a projection. as  
long as the Mind exists, perception, projection, etc.. continues. When, Mano  
Naasam, all is naught.   
The games of your perception, my perception etc.. continue for the mind, is it  
not the projection of the mind?   
Quote  
we can only speak from our standpoint. A Jeevan muktha has body and a Videha  
muktha has no body.  
That everything is only the projection of the mind including the Jivanmukta  
and Videhamukta. When Mano Naasam, there is no Jivanmukta, no Videhamukta, No  
consciousness, no nothing or there is Jivanmukta, there is Videhamukta,  
Consciousness everywhere, Aatman, Brahman.   
These are all again the projections of mind.   
This mind as to merge. this is Mano naasam. As long as there are projections  
of any type, mind has not merged.   
Salutations to Sri Ramana
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100707035910/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16230](http://web.archive.org/web/20100707035910/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16230)

## Re:[45] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 28, 2010, 01:52:04 PM  
---  
Dear prasanth and others,   
The problem is that we are not able to visualize a state where the   
mind is killed. Mind-killing seems to be bothering most of us.   
If you substitute ego with mind, then, we are comfortable. Everyone   
agrees that one should kill the ego. Bhagavan Ramana also concludes   
ULLadu Narpadu by saying, Ahandhai uru azhitale mukti. The destruction of the  
ego is liberation. But Bhagavan Ramana uses   
the phrase mano-nasam in Who am I? He does not say Ahandai nasam. For that  
matter, He never uses the word Ahandai, ego   
in Who am I? directly. This is a poser for all of us! However, He gives one  
description about ahandai or ahankaram in Who am I? He says that "I-thought  
is the first thought from the mind. And this ahankaram."   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100707035729/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16246](http://web.archive.org/web/20100707035729/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16246)

## Re:[51] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: viswanathan         Date: June 29, 2010, 10:51:28 AM  
---  
Quote from: Nagaraj on June 27, 2010, 01:17:46 PM  
Who am I is simply holding on to the 'I'. All the analysis are to be given  
absolutely no importance at all. one need not even learn all these  
intricacies. After all what is the real objective? is not to hold on to the  
'I'? its like, we forget the main dishes served in an plantain leaf and  
showing more interest in the "echils" \- food spilt down from our mouth.   
In the above quote,Mr.Nagaraj has introduced the word "Echils"-food split down  
from the mouth and i thought share some good and ad aspects of "Echil".. In  
tamil this word commonly refers to saliva which we spit..Also, any food left  
over in the plate by the eater is also called "Echils" and is considered  
impure and and unhygienic for others to eat. The people who eat left over  
food(Echils)are looked down in society and also sometimes ridiculed..However,  
it is a a common sight in marriages that the food left over on the plate  
will be thrown in dust bin and will be collected by poorest of poor  
especially gypsies(Narikoravas) to satisfy their hunger.Also the left over  
food thrown in dust bin will be shared by dogs and other animals who are not  
fortunate as us.. In the orthodox brahmin families it is still a practice  
wherein the husband will eat first and the plate will not be washed and will  
have some left over food and in the same plate wife will be served food and  
here the "Echils" is very much nourished by the wife taken as prasad from  
husband and that "Echil" is not considered as unhygienic..However the same  
parent will not approve their children sharing "Echils".During Bhagavan days,  
some of orthodox devotees will wait till Bhagavan finishes eating and when he  
leaves dining hall, they will rush to collect the "Echil"(food left in  
hagavan's plate) and eat it as Bhagavan's prasad. When Bhagavan came to know  
of this practice, he did not approve of this.There was a well known saint by  
name Poondi Swamiyar wherein devotees will eat the food tasted by Poondi  
Swamiar and here "Echil" was very considered as divine and was very much  
respected.In swami suddhananda's ashram, Swami used to advice devotees in  
dining hall to leave some food("Echils") in plate for the animals in the  
ashram.   
During last days of Sri.Ramakrishna Paramahamsha, he was suffering with  
Cancer which was in advanced state.His closest aides who were were serving him  
were afraid to go near him fearing that they will also contract cancer and  
left him.On seeing this, Swami Vivekananda took a glass of liquid and gave it  
to Sri ramakrishna to drink and then Swami Vivekananda drank the left  
over(Echil) in the glass.On seeing this, Sri Ramakrishna's close aides got  
over the fear of Contracting Cancer and started serving him again.

## Re:[53] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 06:47:40 AM  
---  
Dear I   
Quote from: srkudai on June 29, 2010, 07:54:26 AM  
When ego is burnt, still there is role playing, but one knows clearly that one  
is not ravana.   
why should an enlightened person not continue playing the role of Ravana,  
knowing pretty well that there is only Rama?   
Appearances are only projection of the mind, similarly, Ravana is a character  
projected by the mind. When the mind is merged into itself - Self, Ravana  
ceases to be, as there will be no mind for projection of Ravana.   
You have to remain as Rama (actually not even reamaing, you are 'that' Tat  
Tvam Asi), There is no way you can continue playing the role of Ravana, that  
implies that mind is still there.   
Once the mind is merged into Self, there will/should not be any appearances,  
i.e. no more any projections. There will only be Rama and Rama everywhere. No  
more roles, characters, etc...   
If it is so, that the Ravana role continues, and even if that role does not  
affect us as Rama, then still it is only projection of the Mind. Therefore  
Mind has still not merged.   
After enlightenment, realising that the cinema is not real, why do you still  
want to sit and watch the movie that is not there? movie still being continued  
- do you not think that still mind is there projecting the universe?   
Mind has to merge, this is Mano Naasam! which is - absolutely no projections  
at all and no continuing of movies or characters or is it even the  
enlightenment that the roles can continue and that it cannot affect you  
anymore.   
These are my humble views   
Salutations to Sri Ramana

## Re:[55] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 07:06:12 AM  
---  
A Jeevan Muktha is said to have had release from body and still exist in the  
body for **outsiders** like ourselves. It is Videha muktha what you are  
talking about.   
In Sadashiva Brahmendral, we have seen how his hands were chopped off and yet  
he continued to walk without even being aware of it. We all know how Ramana  
Maharshi had his tumor operated without even taking anesthesia.   
It only appears for outsiders like ourselves that a Jivanmukta has prarabdha,  
that they have body, etc.., but they do not have any prarabdha or body.   
Salutations to Sri Ramana

For one who falls into the thoughts, who is thinking he is the doer. ..  
"inquire" is suggested.   
so, inquiry is not as long as the world appears. it is as long as one is  
thinks one is not the Self: Just Be.   
Ramana saw all this. Everything.

## Re:[51] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: viswanathan         Date: June 29, 2010, 10:51:28 AM  
---  
Quote from: Nagaraj on June 27, 2010, 01:17:46 PM  
Who am I is simply holding on to the 'I'. All the analysis are to be given  
absolutely no importance at all. one need not even learn all these  
intricacies. After all what is the real objective? is not to hold on to the  
'I'? its like, we forget the main dishes served in an plantain leaf and  
showing more interest in the "echils" \- food spilt down from our mouth.   
In the above quote,Mr.Nagaraj has introduced the word "Echils"-food split down  
from the mouth and i thought share some good and ad aspects of "Echil".. In  
tamil this word commonly refers to saliva which we spit..Also, any food left  
over in the plate by the eater is also called "Echils" and is considered  
impure and and unhygienic for others to eat. The people who eat left over  
food(Echils)are looked down in society and also sometimes ridiculed..However,  
it is a a common sight in marriages that the food left over on the plate  
will be thrown in dust bin and will be collected by poorest of poor  
especially gypsies(Narikoravas) to satisfy their hunger.Also the left over  
food thrown in dust bin will be shared by dogs and other animals who are not  
fortunate as us.. In the orthodox brahmin families it is still a practice  
wherein the husband will eat first and the plate will not be washed and will  
have some left over food and in the same plate wife will be served food and  
here the "Echils" is very much nourished by the wife taken as prasad from  
husband and that "Echil" is not considered as unhygienic..However the same  
parent will not approve their children sharing "Echils".During Bhagavan days,  
some of orthodox devotees will wait till Bhagavan finishes eating and when he  
leaves dining hall, they will rush to collect the "Echil"(food left in  
hagavan's plate) and eat it as Bhagavan's prasad. When Bhagavan came to know  
of this practice, he did not approve of this.There was a well known saint by  
name Poondi Swamiyar wherein devotees will eat the food tasted by Poondi  
Swamiar and here "Echil" was very considered as divine and was very much  
respected.In swami suddhananda's ashram, Swami used to advice devotees in  
dining hall to leave some food("Echils") in plate for the animals in the  
ashram.   
During last days of Sri.Ramakrishna Paramahamsha, he was suffering with  
Cancer which was in advanced state.His closest aides who were were serving him  
were afraid to go near him fearing that they will also contract cancer and  
left him.On seeing this, Swami Vivekananda took a glass of liquid and gave it  
to Sri ramakrishna to drink and then Swami Vivekananda drank the left  
over(Echil) in the glass.On seeing this, Sri Ramakrishna's close aides got  
over the fear of Contracting Cancer and started serving him again.

## Re:[53] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 06:47:40 AM  
---  
Dear I   
Quote from: srkudai on June 29, 2010, 07:54:26 AM  
When ego is burnt, still there is role playing, but one knows clearly that one  
is not ravana.   
why should an enlightened person not continue playing the role of Ravana,  
knowing pretty well that there is only Rama?   
Appearances are only projection of the mind, similarly, Ravana is a character  
projected by the mind. When the mind is merged into itself - Self, Ravana  
ceases to be, as there will be no mind for projection of Ravana.   
You have to remain as Rama (actually not even reamaing, you are 'that' Tat  
Tvam Asi), There is no way you can continue playing the role of Ravana, that  
implies that mind is still there.   
Once the mind is merged into Self, there will/should not be any appearances,  
i.e. no more any projections. There will only be Rama and Rama everywhere. No  
more roles, characters, etc...   
If it is so, that the Ravana role continues, and even if that role does not  
affect us as Rama, then still it is only projection of the Mind. Therefore  
Mind has still not merged.   
After enlightenment, realising that the cinema is not real, why do you still  
want to sit and watch the movie that is not there? movie still being continued  
- do you not think that still mind is there projecting the universe?   
Mind has to merge, this is Mano Naasam! which is - absolutely no projections  
at all and no continuing of movies or characters or is it even the  
enlightenment that the roles can continue and that it cannot affect you  
anymore.   
These are my humble views   
Salutations to Sri Ramana

## Re:[55] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 07:06:12 AM  
---  
A Jeevan Muktha is said to have had release from body and still exist in the  
body for **outsiders** like ourselves. It is Videha muktha what you are  
talking about.   
In Sadashiva Brahmendral, we have seen how his hands were chopped off and yet  
he continued to walk without even being aware of it. We all know how Ramana  
Maharshi had his tumor operated without even taking anesthesia.   
It only appears for outsiders like ourselves that a Jivanmukta has prarabdha,  
that they have body, etc.., but they do not have any prarabdha or body.   
Salutations to Sri Ramana

videha muktha is released from body. jeevan mukha has body.

all these have happened in your view. in your peception.

so there is no projection even now!   
but u speak of ending a projection! which means u have already assumed there  
is a projection.   
if there is a projection, that is in ur view. then that projection ends after

we can only speak from our standpoint. A Jeevan muktha has body and a Videha

## Re:[57] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 07:40:29 AM  
---  
Dear I,   
Every thing that is being discussed is only a 'stand point' of view, which is  
only the mind's. It can never know the consciousness which is unlimited.  
whatever we try and say is only making it limited.   
A Jivan Mukta does not have a body, as consciousness, 'it' is pervaded  
everywhere and everything. No one has body. since it is projection of mind, it  
exists as sanke in rope.   
In the end, you speak from your perception and I speak from my perception.   
There is no your perception and my perception. You are talking to yourself and  
I am talking to myself. There is no You and I.   
Perception exists only for the mind. Perception is again just a projection. as  
long as the Mind exists, perception, projection, etc.. continues. When, Mano  
Naasam, all is naught.   
The games of your perception, my perception etc.. continue for the mind, is it  
not the projection of the mind?   
Quote  
we can only speak from our standpoint. A Jeevan muktha has body and a Videha  
muktha has no body.  
That everything is only the projection of the mind including the Jivanmukta  
and Videhamukta. When Mano Naasam, there is no Jivanmukta, no Videhamukta, No  
consciousness, no nothing or there is Jivanmukta, there is Videhamukta,  
Consciousness everywhere, Aatman, Brahman.   
These are all again the projections of mind.   
This mind as to merge. this is Mano naasam. As long as there are projections  
of any type, mind has not merged.   
Salutations to Sri Ramana
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100707035554/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16247](http://web.archive.org/web/20100707035554/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16247)   
---

there are only two possibilities: A person with merged mind said this. which  
is not possible. coz for him all projections ceased.   
a person whose mind is not merged is saying what will happen when mind merges.  
in this case, how does he know?   
both cases are meaningless.   
simple point... merging of mind is not absence of projection. its just veiling

final merging or elimination of projection is videha mukti. not jeevan mukthi.

## Re:[45] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 28, 2010, 01:52:04 PM  
---  
Dear prasanth and others,   
The problem is that we are not able to visualize a state where the   
mind is killed. Mind-killing seems to be bothering most of us.   
If you substitute ego with mind, then, we are comfortable. Everyone   
agrees that one should kill the ego. Bhagavan Ramana also concludes   
ULLadu Narpadu by saying, Ahandhai uru azhitale mukti. The destruction of the  
ego is liberation. But Bhagavan Ramana uses   
the phrase mano-nasam in Who am I? He does not say Ahandai nasam. For that  
matter, He never uses the word Ahandai, ego   
in Who am I? directly. This is a poser for all of us! However, He gives one  
description about ahandai or ahankaram in Who am I? He says that "I-thought  
is the first thought from the mind. And this ahankaram."   
Arunachala Siva.

## Re:[53] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 06:47:40 AM  
---  
Dear I   
Quote from: srkudai on June 29, 2010, 07:54:26 AM  
When ego is burnt, still there is role playing, but one knows clearly that one  
is not ravana.   
why should an enlightened person not continue playing the role of Ravana,  
knowing pretty well that there is only Rama?   
Appearances are only projection of the mind, similarly, Ravana is a character  
projected by the mind. When the mind is merged into itself - Self, Ravana  
ceases to be, as there will be no mind for projection of Ravana.   
You have to remain as Rama (actually not even reamaing, you are 'that' Tat  
Tvam Asi), There is no way you can continue playing the role of Ravana, that  
implies that mind is still there.   
Once the mind is merged into Self, there will/should not be any appearances,  
i.e. no more any projections. There will only be Rama and Rama everywhere. No  
more roles, characters, etc...   
If it is so, that the Ravana role continues, and even if that role does not  
affect us as Rama, then still it is only projection of the Mind. Therefore  
Mind has still not merged.   
After enlightenment, realising that the cinema is not real, why do you still  
want to sit and watch the movie that is not there? movie still being continued  
- do you not think that still mind is there projecting the universe?   
Mind has to merge, this is Mano Naasam! which is - absolutely no projections  
at all and no continuing of movies or characters or is it even the  
enlightenment that the roles can continue and that it cannot affect you  
anymore.   
These are my humble views   
Salutations to Sri Ramana   
« _Last Edit: June 30, 2010, 06:52:19 AM by Nagaraj_  
Content:

## Re:[55] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 07:06:12 AM  
---  
A Jeevan Muktha is said to have had release from body and still exist in the  
body for **outsiders** like ourselves. It is Videha muktha what you are  
talking about.   
In Sadashiva Brahmendral, we have seen how his hands were chopped off and yet  
he continued to walk without even being aware of it. We all know how Ramana  
Maharshi had his tumor operated without even taking anesthesia.   
It only appears for outsiders like ourselves that a Jivanmukta has prarabdha,  
that they have body, etc.., but they do not have any prarabdha or body.   
Salutations to Sri Ramana

## Re:[57] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 07:40:29 AM  
---  
Dear I,   
Every thing that is being discussed is only a 'stand point' of view, which is  
only the mind's. It can never know the consciousness which is unlimited.  
whatever we try and say is only making it limited.   
A Jivan Mukta does not have a body, as consciousness, 'it' is pervaded  
everywhere and everything. No one has body. since it is projection of mind, it  
exists as sanke in rope.   
In the end, you speak from your perception and I speak from my perception.   
There is no your perception and my perception. You are talking to yourself and  
I am talking to myself. There is no You and I.   
Perception exists only for the mind. Perception is again just a projection. as  
long as the Mind exists, perception, projection, etc.. continues. When, Mano  
Naasam, all is naught.   
The games of your perception, my perception etc.. continue for the mind, is it  
not the projection of the mind?   
Quote  
we can only speak from our standpoint. A Jeevan muktha has body and a Videha  
muktha has no body.  
That everything is only the projection of the mind including the Jivanmukta  
and Videhamukta. When Mano Naasam, there is no Jivanmukta, no Videhamukta, No  
consciousness, no nothing or there is Jivanmukta, there is Videhamukta,  
Consciousness everywhere, Aatman, Brahman.   
These are all again the projections of mind.   
This mind as to merge. this is Mano naasam. As long as there are projections  
of any type, mind has not merged.   
Salutations to Sri Ramana
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100707035631/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16276](http://web.archive.org/web/20100707035631/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16276)

## Re:[45] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 28, 2010, 01:52:04 PM  
---  
Dear prasanth and others,   
The problem is that we are not able to visualize a state where the   
mind is killed. Mind-killing seems to be bothering most of us.   
If you substitute ego with mind, then, we are comfortable. Everyone   
agrees that one should kill the ego. Bhagavan Ramana also concludes   
ULLadu Narpadu by saying, Ahandhai uru azhitale mukti. The destruction of the  
ego is liberation. But Bhagavan Ramana uses   
the phrase mano-nasam in Who am I? He does not say Ahandai nasam. For that  
matter, He never uses the word Ahandai, ego   
in Who am I? directly. This is a poser for all of us! However, He gives one  
description about ahandai or ahankaram in Who am I? He says that "I-thought  
is the first thought from the mind. And this ahankaram."   
Arunachala Siva.

## Re:[51] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: viswanathan         Date: June 29, 2010, 10:51:28 AM  
---  
Quote from: Nagaraj on June 27, 2010, 01:17:46 PM  
Who am I is simply holding on to the 'I'. All the analysis are to be given  
absolutely no importance at all. one need not even learn all these  
intricacies. After all what is the real objective? is not to hold on to the  
'I'? its like, we forget the main dishes served in an plantain leaf and  
showing more interest in the "echils" \- food spilt down from our mouth.   
In the above quote,Mr.Nagaraj has introduced the word "Echils"-food split down  
from the mouth and i thought share some good and ad aspects of "Echil".. In  
tamil this word commonly refers to saliva which we spit..Also, any food left  
over in the plate by the eater is also called "Echils" and is considered  
impure and and unhygienic for others to eat. The people who eat left over  
food(Echils)are looked down in society and also sometimes ridiculed..However,  
it is a a common sight in marriages that the food left over on the plate  
will be thrown in dust bin and will be collected by poorest of poor  
especially gypsies(Narikoravas) to satisfy their hunger.Also the left over  
food thrown in dust bin will be shared by dogs and other animals who are not  
fortunate as us.. In the orthodox brahmin families it is still a practice  
wherein the husband will eat first and the plate will not be washed and will  
have some left over food and in the same plate wife will be served food and  
here the "Echils" is very much nourished by the wife taken as prasad from  
husband and that "Echil" is not considered as unhygienic..However the same  
parent will not approve their children sharing "Echils".During Bhagavan days,  
some of orthodox devotees will wait till Bhagavan finishes eating and when he  
leaves dining hall, they will rush to collect the "Echil"(food left in  
hagavan's plate) and eat it as Bhagavan's prasad. When Bhagavan came to know  
of this practice, he did not approve of this.There was a well known saint by  
name Poondi Swamiyar wherein devotees will eat the food tasted by Poondi  
Swamiar and here "Echil" was very considered as divine and was very much  
respected.In swami suddhananda's ashram, Swami used to advice devotees in  
dining hall to leave some food("Echils") in plate for the animals in the  
ashram.   
During last days of Sri.Ramakrishna Paramahamsha, he was suffering with  
Cancer which was in advanced state.His closest aides who were were serving him  
were afraid to go near him fearing that they will also contract cancer and  
left him.On seeing this, Swami Vivekananda took a glass of liquid and gave it  
to Sri ramakrishna to drink and then Swami Vivekananda drank the left  
over(Echil) in the glass.On seeing this, Sri Ramakrishna's close aides got  
over the fear of Contracting Cancer and started serving him again.

Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 07:40:29 AM  
---  
Dear I,   
Every thing that is being discussed is only a 'stand point' of view, which is  
only the mind's. It can never know the consciousness which is unlimited.  
whatever we try and say is only making it limited.   
A Jivan Mukta does not have a body, as consciousness, 'it' is pervaded  
everywhere and everything. No one has body. since it is projection of mind, it  
exists as sanke in rope.   
In the end, you speak from your perception and I speak from my perception.   
There is no your perception and my perception. You are talking to yourself and  
I am talking to myself. There is no You and I.   
Perception exists only for the mind. Perception is again just a projection. as  
long as the Mind exists, perception, projection, etc.. continues. When, Mano  
Naasam, all is naught.   
The games of your perception, my perception etc.. continue for the mind, is it  
not the projection of the mind?   
Quote  
we can only speak from our standpoint. A Jeevan muktha has body and a Videha  
muktha has no body.  
That everything is only the projection of the mind including the Jivanmukta  
and Videhamukta. When Mano Naasam, there is no Jivanmukta, no Videhamukta, No  
consciousness, no nothing or there is Jivanmukta, there is Videhamukta,  
Consciousness everywhere, Aatman, Brahman.   
These are all again the projections of mind.   
This mind as to merge. this is Mano naasam. As long as there are projections  
of any type, mind has not merged.   
Salutations to Sri Ramana
 ---

## Re:[45] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 28, 2010, 01:52:04 PM  
---  
Dear prasanth and others,   
The problem is that we are not able to visualize a state where the   
mind is killed. Mind-killing seems to be bothering most of us.   
If you substitute ego with mind, then, we are comfortable. Everyone   
agrees that one should kill the ego. Bhagavan Ramana also concludes   
ULLadu Narpadu by saying, Ahandhai uru azhitale mukti. The destruction of the  
ego is liberation. But Bhagavan Ramana uses   
the phrase mano-nasam in Who am I? He does not say Ahandai nasam. For that  
matter, He never uses the word Ahandai, ego   
in Who am I? directly. This is a poser for all of us! However, He gives one  
description about ahandai or ahankaram in Who am I? He says that "I-thought  
is the first thought from the mind. And this ahankaram."   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100707040034/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16282](http://web.archive.org/web/20100707040034/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16282)

## Re:[51] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: viswanathan         Date: June 29, 2010, 10:51:28 AM  
---  
Quote from: Nagaraj on June 27, 2010, 01:17:46 PM  
Who am I is simply holding on to the 'I'. All the analysis are to be given  
absolutely no importance at all. one need not even learn all these  
intricacies. After all what is the real objective? is not to hold on to the  
'I'? its like, we forget the main dishes served in an plantain leaf and  
showing more interest in the "echils" \- food spilt down from our mouth.   
In the above quote,Mr.Nagaraj has introduced the word "Echils"-food split down  
from the mouth and i thought share some good and ad aspects of "Echil".. In  
tamil this word commonly refers to saliva which we spit..Also, any food left  
over in the plate by the eater is also called "Echils" and is considered  
impure and and unhygienic for others to eat. The people who eat left over  
food(Echils)are looked down in society and also sometimes ridiculed..However,  
it is a a common sight in marriages that the food left over on the plate  
will be thrown in dust bin and will be collected by poorest of poor  
especially gypsies(Narikoravas) to satisfy their hunger.Also the left over  
food thrown in dust bin will be shared by dogs and other animals who are not  
fortunate as us.. In the orthodox brahmin families it is still a practice  
wherein the husband will eat first and the plate will not be washed and will  
have some left over food and in the same plate wife will be served food and  
here the "Echils" is very much nourished by the wife taken as prasad from  
husband and that "Echil" is not considered as unhygienic..However the same  
parent will not approve their children sharing "Echils".During Bhagavan days,  
some of orthodox devotees will wait till Bhagavan finishes eating and when he  
leaves dining hall, they will rush to collect the "Echil"(food left in  
hagavan's plate) and eat it as Bhagavan's prasad. When Bhagavan came to know  
of this practice, he did not approve of this.There was a well known saint by  
name Poondi Swamiyar wherein devotees will eat the food tasted by Poondi  
Swamiar and here "Echil" was very considered as divine and was very much  
respected.In swami suddhananda's ashram, Swami used to advice devotees in  
dining hall to leave some food("Echils") in plate for the animals in the  
ashram.   
During last days of Sri.Ramakrishna Paramahamsha, he was suffering with  
Cancer which was in advanced state.His closest aides who were were serving him  
were afraid to go near him fearing that they will also contract cancer and  
left him.On seeing this, Swami Vivekananda took a glass of liquid and gave it  
to Sri ramakrishna to drink and then Swami Vivekananda drank the left  
over(Echil) in the glass.On seeing this, Sri Ramakrishna's close aides got  
over the fear of Contracting Cancer and started serving him again.

## Re:[53] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 06:47:40 AM  
---  
Dear I   
Quote from: srkudai on June 29, 2010, 07:54:26 AM  
When ego is burnt, still there is role playing, but one knows clearly that one  
is not ravana.   
why should an enlightened person not continue playing the role of Ravana,  
knowing pretty well that there is only Rama?   
Appearances are only projection of the mind, similarly, Ravana is a character  
projected by the mind. When the mind is merged into itself - Self, Ravana  
ceases to be, as there will be no mind for projection of Ravana.   
You have to remain as Rama (actually not even reamaing, you are 'that' Tat  
Tvam Asi), There is no way you can continue playing the role of Ravana, that  
implies that mind is still there.   
Once the mind is merged into Self, there will/should not be any appearances,  
i.e. no more any projections. There will only be Rama and Rama everywhere. No  
more roles, characters, etc...   
If it is so, that the Ravana role continues, and even if that role does not  
affect us as Rama, then still it is only projection of the Mind. Therefore  
Mind has still not merged.   
After enlightenment, realising that the cinema is not real, why do you still  
want to sit and watch the movie that is not there? movie still being continued  
- do you not think that still mind is there projecting the universe?   
Mind has to merge, this is Mano Naasam! which is - absolutely no projections  
at all and no continuing of movies or characters or is it even the  
enlightenment that the roles can continue and that it cannot affect you  
anymore.   
These are my humble views   
Salutations to Sri Ramana

## Re:[55] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 07:06:12 AM  
---  
A Jeevan Muktha is said to have had release from body and still exist in the  
body for **outsiders** like ourselves. It is Videha muktha what you are  
talking about.   
In Sadashiva Brahmendral, we have seen how his hands were chopped off and yet  
he continued to walk without even being aware of it. We all know how Ramana  
Maharshi had his tumor operated without even taking anesthesia.   
It only appears for outsiders like ourselves that a Jivanmukta has prarabdha,  
that they have body, etc.., but they do not have any prarabdha or body.   
Salutations to Sri Ramana

I am Self. .. As the Ultimate.   
The Role of Ravana need not be destroyed. If I do not know i am Ravana, i  
cannot play that role.   
I just have to know that I am Self [mentally]. And have firm conviction.   
There it ends.   
nothing more, nothing less.   
That is why Ramakrishna says "the ego is like a burnt rope", coz it no more  
creates confusion. there is clarity. i know i am playing the role of Ravana  
but all this is mithya. This is simple.   
Love!   
Silence

## Re:[51] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: viswanathan         Date: June 29, 2010, 10:51:28 AM  
---  
Quote from: Nagaraj on June 27, 2010, 01:17:46 PM  
Who am I is simply holding on to the 'I'. All the analysis are to be given  
absolutely no importance at all. one need not even learn all these  
intricacies. After all what is the real objective? is not to hold on to the  
'I'? its like, we forget the main dishes served in an plantain leaf and  
showing more interest in the "echils" \- food spilt down from our mouth.   
In the above quote,Mr.Nagaraj has introduced the word "Echils"-food split down  
from the mouth and i thought share some good and ad aspects of "Echil".. In  
tamil this word commonly refers to saliva which we spit..Also, any food left  
over in the plate by the eater is also called "Echils" and is considered  
impure and and unhygienic for others to eat. The people who eat left over  
food(Echils)are looked down in society and also sometimes ridiculed..However,  
it is a a common sight in marriages that the food left over on the plate  
will be thrown in dust bin and will be collected by poorest of poor  
especially gypsies(Narikoravas) to satisfy their hunger.Also the left over  
food thrown in dust bin will be shared by dogs and other animals who are not  
fortunate as us.. In the orthodox brahmin families it is still a practice  
wherein the husband will eat first and the plate will not be washed and will  
have some left over food and in the same plate wife will be served food and  
here the "Echils" is very much nourished by the wife taken as prasad from  
husband and that "Echil" is not considered as unhygienic..However the same  
parent will not approve their children sharing "Echils".During Bhagavan days,  
some of orthodox devotees will wait till Bhagavan finishes eating and when he  
leaves dining hall, they will rush to collect the "Echil"(food left in  
hagavan's plate) and eat it as Bhagavan's prasad. When Bhagavan came to know  
of this practice, he did not approve of this.There was a well known saint by  
name Poondi Swamiyar wherein devotees will eat the food tasted by Poondi  
Swamiar and here "Echil" was very considered as divine and was very much  
respected.In swami suddhananda's ashram, Swami used to advice devotees in  
dining hall to leave some food("Echils") in plate for the animals in the  
ashram.   
During last days of Sri.Ramakrishna Paramahamsha, he was suffering with  
Cancer which was in advanced state.His closest aides who were were serving him  
were afraid to go near him fearing that they will also contract cancer and  
left him.On seeing this, Swami Vivekananda took a glass of liquid and gave it  
to Sri ramakrishna to drink and then Swami Vivekananda drank the left  
over(Echil) in the glass.On seeing this, Sri Ramakrishna's close aides got  
over the fear of Contracting Cancer and started serving him again.

## Re:[53] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 06:47:40 AM  
---  
Dear I   
Quote from: srkudai on June 29, 2010, 07:54:26 AM  
When ego is burnt, still there is role playing, but one knows clearly that one  
is not ravana.   
why should an enlightened person not continue playing the role of Ravana,  
knowing pretty well that there is only Rama?   
Appearances are only projection of the mind, similarly, Ravana is a character  
projected by the mind. When the mind is merged into itself - Self, Ravana  
ceases to be, as there will be no mind for projection of Ravana.   
You have to remain as Rama (actually not even reamaing, you are 'that' Tat  
Tvam Asi), There is no way you can continue playing the role of Ravana, that  
implies that mind is still there.   
Once the mind is merged into Self, there will/should not be any appearances,  
i.e. no more any projections. There will only be Rama and Rama everywhere. No  
more roles, characters, etc...   
If it is so, that the Ravana role continues, and even if that role does not  
affect us as Rama, then still it is only projection of the Mind. Therefore  
Mind has still not merged.   
After enlightenment, realising that the cinema is not real, why do you still  
want to sit and watch the movie that is not there? movie still being continued  
- do you not think that still mind is there projecting the universe?   
Mind has to merge, this is Mano Naasam! which is - absolutely no projections  
at all and no continuing of movies or characters or is it even the  
enlightenment that the roles can continue and that it cannot affect you  
anymore.   
These are my humble views   
Salutations to Sri Ramana

Content:

## Re:[55] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 07:06:12 AM  
---  
A Jeevan Muktha is said to have had release from body and still exist in the  
body for **outsiders** like ourselves. It is Videha muktha what you are  
talking about.   
In Sadashiva Brahmendral, we have seen how his hands were chopped off and yet  
he continued to walk without even being aware of it. We all know how Ramana  
Maharshi had his tumor operated without even taking anesthesia.   
It only appears for outsiders like ourselves that a Jivanmukta has prarabdha,  
that they have body, etc.., but they do not have any prarabdha or body.   
Salutations to Sri Ramana

videha muktha is released from body. jeevan mukha has body.

all these have happened in your view. in your peception.   
so lets speak from your perception.

and yet he is speaking. if u ask, the reply is "in ur view i am speaking to  
u".   
then how come u say a jeevan muktha has no body? No one has a body that way.   
so there is no projection even now!   
but u speak of ending a projection! which means u have already assumed there  
is a projection.   
if there is a projection, that is in ur view. then that projection ends after  
videha mukti. .. that too in your view.   
we can only speak from our standpoint. A Jeevan muktha has body and a Videha  
muktha has no body.

## Re:[57] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 07:40:29 AM  
---  
Dear I,   
Every thing that is being discussed is only a 'stand point' of view, which is  
only the mind's. It can never know the consciousness which is unlimited.  
whatever we try and say is only making it limited.   
A Jivan Mukta does not have a body, as consciousness, 'it' is pervaded  
everywhere and everything. No one has body. since it is projection of mind, it  
exists as sanke in rope.   
In the end, you speak from your perception and I speak from my perception.   
There is no your perception and my perception. You are talking to yourself and  
I am talking to myself. There is no You and I.   
Perception exists only for the mind. Perception is again just a projection. as  
long as the Mind exists, perception, projection, etc.. continues. When, Mano  
Naasam, all is naught.   
The games of your perception, my perception etc.. continue for the mind, is it  
not the projection of the mind?   
Quote  
we can only speak from our standpoint. A Jeevan muktha has body and a Videha  
muktha has no body.  
That everything is only the projection of the mind including the Jivanmukta  
and Videhamukta. When Mano Naasam, there is no Jivanmukta, no Videhamukta, No  
consciousness, no nothing or there is Jivanmukta, there is Videhamukta,  
Consciousness everywhere, Aatman, Brahman.   
These are all again the projections of mind.   
This mind as to merge. this is Mano naasam. As long as there are projections  
of any type, mind has not merged.   
Salutations to Sri Ramana
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100707035949/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16284](http://web.archive.org/web/20100707035949/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16284)

there are only two possibilities: A person with merged mind said this. which

a person whose mind is not merged is saying what will happen when mind merges.

both cases are meaningless.   
simple point... merging of mind is not absence of projection. its just veiling

final merging or elimination of projection is videha mukti. not jeevan mukthi.

## Re:[45] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 28, 2010, 01:52:04 PM  
---  
Dear prasanth and others,   
The problem is that we are not able to visualize a state where the   
mind is killed. Mind-killing seems to be bothering most of us.   
If you substitute ego with mind, then, we are comfortable. Everyone   
agrees that one should kill the ego. Bhagavan Ramana also concludes   
ULLadu Narpadu by saying, Ahandhai uru azhitale mukti. The destruction of the  
ego is liberation. But Bhagavan Ramana uses   
the phrase mano-nasam in Who am I? He does not say Ahandai nasam. For that  
matter, He never uses the word Ahandai, ego   
in Who am I? directly. This is a poser for all of us! However, He gives one  
description about ahandai or ahankaram in Who am I? He says that "I-thought  
is the first thought from the mind. And this ahankaram."   
Arunachala Siva.

## Re:[53] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 06:47:40 AM  
---  
Dear I   
Quote from: srkudai on June 29, 2010, 07:54:26 AM  
When ego is burnt, still there is role playing, but one knows clearly that one  
is not ravana.   
why should an enlightened person not continue playing the role of Ravana,  
knowing pretty well that there is only Rama?   
Appearances are only projection of the mind, similarly, Ravana is a character  
projected by the mind. When the mind is merged into itself - Self, Ravana  
ceases to be, as there will be no mind for projection of Ravana.   
You have to remain as Rama (actually not even reamaing, you are 'that' Tat  
Tvam Asi), There is no way you can continue playing the role of Ravana, that  
implies that mind is still there.   
Once the mind is merged into Self, there will/should not be any appearances,  
i.e. no more any projections. There will only be Rama and Rama everywhere. No  
more roles, characters, etc...   
If it is so, that the Ravana role continues, and even if that role does not  
affect us as Rama, then still it is only projection of the Mind. Therefore  
Mind has still not merged.   
After enlightenment, realising that the cinema is not real, why do you still  
want to sit and watch the movie that is not there? movie still being continued  
- do you not think that still mind is there projecting the universe?   
Mind has to merge, this is Mano Naasam! which is - absolutely no projections  
at all and no continuing of movies or characters or is it even the  
enlightenment that the roles can continue and that it cannot affect you  
anymore.   
These are my humble views   
Salutations to Sri Ramana

## Re:[55] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 07:06:12 AM  
---  
A Jeevan Muktha is said to have had release from body and still exist in the  
body for **outsiders** like ourselves. It is Videha muktha what you are  
talking about.   
In Sadashiva Brahmendral, we have seen how his hands were chopped off and yet  
he continued to walk without even being aware of it. We all know how Ramana  
Maharshi had his tumor operated without even taking anesthesia.   
It only appears for outsiders like ourselves that a Jivanmukta has prarabdha,  
that they have body, etc.., but they do not have any prarabdha or body.   
Salutations to Sri Ramana

## Re:[57] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 07:40:29 AM  
---  
Dear I,   
Every thing that is being discussed is only a 'stand point' of view, which is  
only the mind's. It can never know the consciousness which is unlimited.  
whatever we try and say is only making it limited.   
A Jivan Mukta does not have a body, as consciousness, 'it' is pervaded  
everywhere and everything. No one has body. since it is projection of mind, it  
exists as sanke in rope.   
In the end, you speak from your perception and I speak from my perception.   
There is no your perception and my perception. You are talking to yourself and  
I am talking to myself. There is no You and I.   
Perception exists only for the mind. Perception is again just a projection. as  
long as the Mind exists, perception, projection, etc.. continues. When, Mano  
Naasam, all is naught.   
The games of your perception, my perception etc.. continue for the mind, is it  
not the projection of the mind?   
Quote  
we can only speak from our standpoint. A Jeevan muktha has body and a Videha  
muktha has no body.  
That everything is only the projection of the mind including the Jivanmukta  
and Videhamukta. When Mano Naasam, there is no Jivanmukta, no Videhamukta, No  
consciousness, no nothing or there is Jivanmukta, there is Videhamukta,  
Consciousness everywhere, Aatman, Brahman.   
These are all again the projections of mind.   
This mind as to merge. this is Mano naasam. As long as there are projections  
of any type, mind has not merged.   
Salutations to Sri Ramana
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100707035932/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16285](http://web.archive.org/web/20100707035932/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16285)

final merging or elimination of projection is videha mukti. not jeevan mukthi.

## Re:[45] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 28, 2010, 01:52:04 PM  
---  
Dear prasanth and others,   
The problem is that we are not able to visualize a state where the   
mind is killed. Mind-killing seems to be bothering most of us.   
If you substitute ego with mind, then, we are comfortable. Everyone   
agrees that one should kill the ego. Bhagavan Ramana also concludes   
ULLadu Narpadu by saying, Ahandhai uru azhitale mukti. The destruction of the  
ego is liberation. But Bhagavan Ramana uses   
the phrase mano-nasam in Who am I? He does not say Ahandai nasam. For that  
matter, He never uses the word Ahandai, ego   
in Who am I? directly. This is a poser for all of us! However, He gives one  
description about ahandai or ahankaram in Who am I? He says that "I-thought  
is the first thought from the mind. And this ahankaram."   
Arunachala Siva.

## Re:[51] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: viswanathan         Date: June 29, 2010, 10:51:28 AM  
---  
Quote from: Nagaraj on June 27, 2010, 01:17:46 PM  
Who am I is simply holding on to the 'I'. All the analysis are to be given  
absolutely no importance at all. one need not even learn all these  
intricacies. After all what is the real objective? is not to hold on to the  
'I'? its like, we forget the main dishes served in an plantain leaf and  
showing more interest in the "echils" \- food spilt down from our mouth.   
In the above quote,Mr.Nagaraj has introduced the word "Echils"-food split down  
from the mouth and i thought share some good and ad aspects of "Echil".. In  
tamil this word commonly refers to saliva which we spit..Also, any food left  
over in the plate by the eater is also called "Echils" and is considered  
impure and and unhygienic for others to eat. The people who eat left over  
food(Echils)are looked down in society and also sometimes ridiculed..However,  
it is a a common sight in marriages that the food left over on the plate  
will be thrown in dust bin and will be collected by poorest of poor  
especially gypsies(Narikoravas) to satisfy their hunger.Also the left over  
food thrown in dust bin will be shared by dogs and other animals who are not  
fortunate as us.. In the orthodox brahmin families it is still a practice  
wherein the husband will eat first and the plate will not be washed and will  
have some left over food and in the same plate wife will be served food and  
here the "Echils" is very much nourished by the wife taken as prasad from  
husband and that "Echil" is not considered as unhygienic..However the same  
parent will not approve their children sharing "Echils".During Bhagavan days,  
some of orthodox devotees will wait till Bhagavan finishes eating and when he  
leaves dining hall, they will rush to collect the "Echil"(food left in  
hagavan's plate) and eat it as Bhagavan's prasad. When Bhagavan came to know  
of this practice, he did not approve of this.There was a well known saint by  
name Poondi Swamiyar wherein devotees will eat the food tasted by Poondi  
Swamiar and here "Echil" was very considered as divine and was very much  
respected.In swami suddhananda's ashram, Swami used to advice devotees in  
dining hall to leave some food("Echils") in plate for the animals in the  
ashram.   
During last days of Sri.Ramakrishna Paramahamsha, he was suffering with  
Cancer which was in advanced state.His closest aides who were were serving him  
were afraid to go near him fearing that they will also contract cancer and  
left him.On seeing this, Swami Vivekananda took a glass of liquid and gave it  
to Sri ramakrishna to drink and then Swami Vivekananda drank the left  
over(Echil) in the glass.On seeing this, Sri Ramakrishna's close aides got  
over the fear of Contracting Cancer and started serving him again.

muktha has no body.  
That everything is only the projection of the mind including the Jivanmukta  
and Videhamukta. When Mano Naasam, there is no Jivanmukta, no Videhamukta, No  
consciousness, no nothing or there is Jivanmukta, there is Videhamukta,

of any type, mind has not merged.

Dear prasanth and others,   
The problem is that we are not able to visualize a state where the   
mind is killed. Mind-killing seems to be bothering most of us.   
If you substitute ego with mind, then, we are comfortable. Everyone   
agrees that one should kill the ego. Bhagavan Ramana also concludes   
ULLadu Narpadu by saying, Ahandhai uru azhitale mukti. The destruction of the  
ego is liberation. But Bhagavan Ramana uses   
the phrase mano-nasam in Who am I? He does not say Ahandai nasam. For that  
matter, He never uses the word Ahandai, ego   
in Who am I? directly. This is a poser for all of us! However, He gives one  
description about ahandai or ahankaram in Who am I? He says that "I-thought  
is the first thought from the mind. And this ahankaram."   
Arunachala Siva.

## Re:[51] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: viswanathan         Date: June 29, 2010, 10:51:28 AM  
---  
Quote from: Nagaraj on June 27, 2010, 01:17:46 PM  
Who am I is simply holding on to the 'I'. All the analysis are to be given  
absolutely no importance at all. one need not even learn all these  
intricacies. After all what is the real objective? is not to hold on to the  
'I'? its like, we forget the main dishes served in an plantain leaf and  
showing more interest in the "echils" \- food spilt down from our mouth.   
In the above quote,Mr.Nagaraj has introduced the word "Echils"-food split down  
from the mouth and i thought share some good and ad aspects of "Echil".. In  
tamil this word commonly refers to saliva which we spit..Also, any food left  
over in the plate by the eater is also called "Echils" and is considered  
impure and and unhygienic for others to eat. The people who eat left over  
food(Echils)are looked down in society and also sometimes ridiculed..However,  
it is a a common sight in marriages that the food left over on the plate  
will be thrown in dust bin and will be collected by poorest of poor  
especially gypsies(Narikoravas) to satisfy their hunger.Also the left over  
food thrown in dust bin will be shared by dogs and other animals who are not  
fortunate as us.. In the orthodox brahmin families it is still a practice  
wherein the husband will eat first and the plate will not be washed and will  
have some left over food and in the same plate wife will be served food and  
here the "Echils" is very much nourished by the wife taken as prasad from  
husband and that "Echil" is not considered as unhygienic..However the same  
parent will not approve their children sharing "Echils".During Bhagavan days,  
some of orthodox devotees will wait till Bhagavan finishes eating and when he  
leaves dining hall, they will rush to collect the "Echil"(food left in  
hagavan's plate) and eat it as Bhagavan's prasad. When Bhagavan came to know  
of this practice, he did not approve of this.There was a well known saint by  
name Poondi Swamiyar wherein devotees will eat the food tasted by Poondi  
Swamiar and here "Echil" was very considered as divine and was very much  
respected.In swami suddhananda's ashram, Swami used to advice devotees in  
dining hall to leave some food("Echils") in plate for the animals in the  
ashram.   
During last days of Sri.Ramakrishna Paramahamsha, he was suffering with  
Cancer which was in advanced state.His closest aides who were were serving him  
were afraid to go near him fearing that they will also contract cancer and  
left him.On seeing this, Swami Vivekananda took a glass of liquid and gave it  
to Sri ramakrishna to drink and then Swami Vivekananda drank the left  
over(Echil) in the glass.On seeing this, Sri Ramakrishna's close aides got  
over the fear of Contracting Cancer and started serving him again.

## Re:[53] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Nagaraj             Date: June 30, 2010, 06:47:40 AM  
---  
Dear I   
Quote from: srkudai on June 29, 2010, 07:54:26 AM  
When ego is burnt, still there is role playing, but one knows clearly that one  
is not ravana.   
why should an enlightened person not continue playing the role of Ravana,  
knowing pretty well that there is only Rama?   
Appearances are only projection of the mind, similarly, Ravana is a character  
projected by the mind. When the mind is merged into itself - Self, Ravana  
ceases to be, as there will be no mind for projection of Ravana.   
You have to remain as Rama (actually not even reamaing, you are 'that' Tat  
Tvam Asi), There is no way you can continue playing the role of Ravana, that  
implies that mind is still there.   
Once the mind is merged into Self, there will/should not be any appearances,  
i.e. no more any projections. There will only be Rama and Rama everywhere. No  
more roles, characters, etc...   
If it is so, that the Ravana role continues, and even if that role does not  
affect us as Rama, then still it is only projection of the Mind. Therefore  
Mind has still not merged.   
After enlightenment, realising that the cinema is not real, why do you still  
want to sit and watch the movie that is not there? movie still being continued  
- do you not think that still mind is there projecting the universe?   
Mind has to merge, this is Mano Naasam! which is - absolutely no projections  
at all and no continuing of movies or characters or is it even the  
enlightenment that the roles can continue and that it cannot affect you  
anymore.   
These are my humble views   
Salutations to Sri Ramana

## Re:[62] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 30, 2010, 09:10:40 AM  
---  
Dear Nagaraj & viswanthan,   
I shall cover only the explanation given for "Echil", the Tamizh word.   
This word is used in both occasions, i.e. 1) referring to the saliva that is  
coming out of the mouth and 2) the left-overs of the food [perhaps since it  
contains a touch of saliva while eating]. A Guru's or Jnani's left over of  
the food is considered sacred and it is called Ucchishtam. This is taken by  
the devotees. This Ucchishtam also   
includes the drinking water from a tumbler partly used by the guru.   
[An extreme case of Ucchishtam is taking the water from a basin,   
where guru's pada were cleaned with water while entering the house. This  
water is consumed by the devotees!]   
In Bhagavan Ramana's time, this taking of left over food was   
practiced by some devotees in the early years. They were also taking the  
water from the tumbler which Bhagavan Ramana had used while taking food. This  
is was found out by Bhagavan, from a little girl who was waiting for Bhagavan  
to finish His lunch and get up, so that she could take the water from the  
tumbler. After this, Bhagavan Ramana saw to it that there was no water left  
behind. He chided the devotees also.   
The food ucchishtam again was observed by the devotees, in a SELECTIVE way!  
That is, in the lunch when Mudaliar Patti's food was served on Bhagavan's  
leaf, it was considered "not suitable" for devotees to sit at the same leaf  
and eat food. So they were doing this at night-meals. Bhagavan Ramana also  
noticed this and started taking the leaf Himself and placing it on the  
dustbin.   
Once Muruganar wanted to take this Ucchishtam. When he went for in the  
morning for sitting before that leaf of Bhagavan that had contained left  
overs, he was prevented saying the Mudaliar Patti's food had been served there  
and so it was 'unsuitable'!   
Muruganar felt bad. While dogs are eligible for that food, I am not. What a  
pity?   
He wrote a poem which reads roughly as-   
This Brahma does not know, not even Vedas but   
Also how to give births to jivas.   
If he had given me a dog's birth, I would have eaten   
 that food!   
He has made me a Brahmin and thus disqualifed me for this great   
 fortune!   
This song is in Sri Ramana Sannidhi Murai. It starts as Thachariyatha  
chaturmari paarpaan....... It is a single verse, and titled as Ucchishta  
Vaibhavam.   
Arunachala Siva.

## Re:[62] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 30, 2010, 09:10:40 AM  
---  
Dear Nagaraj & viswanthan,   
I shall cover only the explanation given for "Echil", the Tamizh word.   
This word is used in both occasions, i.e. 1) referring to the saliva that is  
coming out of the mouth and 2) the left-overs of the food [perhaps since it  
contains a touch of saliva while eating]. A Guru's or Jnani's left over of  
the food is considered sacred and it is called Ucchishtam. This is taken by  
the devotees. This Ucchishtam also   
includes the drinking water from a tumbler partly used by the guru.   
[An extreme case of Ucchishtam is taking the water from a basin,   
where guru's pada were cleaned with water while entering the house. This  
water is consumed by the devotees!]   
In Bhagavan Ramana's time, this taking of left over food was   
practiced by some devotees in the early years. They were also taking the  
water from the tumbler which Bhagavan Ramana had used while taking food. This  
is was found out by Bhagavan, from a little girl who was waiting for Bhagavan  
to finish His lunch and get up, so that she could take the water from the  
tumbler. After this, Bhagavan Ramana saw to it that there was no water left  
behind. He chided the devotees also.   
The food ucchishtam again was observed by the devotees, in a SELECTIVE way!  
That is, in the lunch when Mudaliar Patti's food was served on Bhagavan's  
leaf, it was considered "not suitable" for devotees to sit at the same leaf  
and eat food. So they were doing this at night-meals. Bhagavan Ramana also  
noticed this and started taking the leaf Himself and placing it on the  
dustbin.   
Once Muruganar wanted to take this Ucchishtam. When he went for in the  
morning for sitting before that leaf of Bhagavan that had contained left  
overs, he was prevented saying the Mudaliar Patti's food had been served there  
and so it was 'unsuitable'!   
Muruganar felt bad. While dogs are eligible for that food, I am not. What a  
pity?   
He wrote a poem which reads roughly as-   
This Brahma does not know, not even Vedas but   
Also how to give births to jivas.   
If he had given me a dog's birth, I would have eaten   
 that food!   
He has made me a Brahmin and thus disqualifed me for this great   
 fortune!   
This song is in Sri Ramana Sannidhi Murai. It starts as Thachariyatha  
chaturmari paarpaan....... It is a single verse, and titled as Ucchishta  
Vaibhavam.   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100707032130/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16289](http://web.archive.org/web/20100707032130/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16289)   
---

## Re:[62] Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attention?  
Author: Subramanian.R       Date: June 30, 2010, 09:10:40 AM  
---  
Dear Nagaraj & viswanthan,   
I shall cover only the explanation given for "Echil", the Tamizh word.   
This word is used in both occasions, i.e. 1) referring to the saliva that is  
coming out of the mouth and 2) the left-overs of the food [perhaps since it  
contains a touch of saliva while eating]. A Guru's or Jnani's left over of  
the food is considered sacred and it is called Ucchishtam. This is taken by  
the devotees. This Ucchishtam also   
includes the drinking water from a tumbler partly used by the guru.   
[An extreme case of Ucchishtam is taking the water from a basin,   
where guru's pada were cleaned with water while entering the house. This  
water is consumed by the devotees!]   
In Bhagavan Ramana's time, this taking of left over food was   
practiced by some devotees in the early years. They were also taking the  
water from the tumbler which Bhagavan Ramana had used while taking food. This  
is was found out by Bhagavan, from a little girl who was waiting for Bhagavan  
to finish His lunch and get up, so that she could take the water from the  
tumbler. After this, Bhagavan Ramana saw to it that there was no water left  
behind. He chided the devotees also.   
The food ucchishtam again was observed by the devotees, in a SELECTIVE way!  
That is, in the lunch when Mudaliar Patti's food was served on Bhagavan's  
leaf, it was considered "not suitable" for devotees to sit at the same leaf  
and eat food. So they were doing this at night-meals. Bhagavan Ramana also  
noticed this and started taking the leaf Himself and placing it on the  
dustbin.   
Once Muruganar wanted to take this Ucchishtam. When he went for in the  
morning for sitting before that leaf of Bhagavan that had contained left  
overs, he was prevented saying the Mudaliar Patti's food had been served there  
and so it was 'unsuitable'!   
Muruganar felt bad. While dogs are eligible for that food, I am not. What a  
pity?   
He wrote a poem which reads roughly as-   
This Brahma does not know, not even Vedas but   
Also how to give births to jivas.   
If he had given me a dog's birth, I would have eaten   
 that food!   
He has made me a Brahmin and thus disqualifed me for this great   
 fortune!   
This song is in Sri Ramana Sannidhi Murai. It starts as Thachariyatha  
chaturmari paarpaan....... It is a single verse, and titled as Ucchishta  
Vaibhavam.   
Arunachala Siva.
 ---  
Source:[http://web.archive.org/web/20100707032030/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16295](http://web.archive.org/web/20100707032030/http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5615.msg16295)

Muruganar felt bad. While dogs are eligible for that food, I am not. What a  
pity?   
He wrote a poem which reads roughly as-   
This Brahma does not know, not even Vedas but   
Also how to give births to jivas.   
If he had given me a dog's birth, I would have eaten   
 that food!   
He has made me a Brahmin and thus disqualifed me for this great   
 fortune!   
This song is in Sri Ramana Sannidhi Murai. It starts as Thachariyatha  
chaturmari paarpaan....... It is a single verse, and titled as Ucchishta  
Vaibhavam.   
Arunachala Siva.

Ramana also mentioned that he had pain!   
without thoughts can Ramana had pain. .. !!??!!??!!   
As Consciousness Ramana or u or me. .. we do not have a body also. so no pain  
or thought.   
This is so even now.   
and in the relative sense the body and thoughts are there.   
coz the relative is mithya, they are said to be non-existent.   
being mithya, they continue to appear, but we know they are like mirage.   
that's jivan mukthi.   
not absence of perception.

## Re:[64]ఓం నమో భగవతే శ్రీ రమణాయ  Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attenti

Quote from: srkudai on June 30, 2010, 09:15:36 AM  
In the relative sense the body and thoughts are there.   
coz the relative is mithya, they are said to be non-existent.   
being mithya, they continue to appear, but we know they are like  
mirage.that's jivan mukthi. **not absence of perception.**  
Excellent discussion.   
I agree with Udai garu.   
Guru ramana has thoughts and felt pain many times and even he was given  
anaesthesia in few instances.   
Quote  
Once ramana maharshi had toochache problem and a The dentist came, stayed here  
three days, charging Rs.300-0-0 for his stay and did nothing substantial,  
except cleaning his teeth, pulling out one tooth and a part of another.   
http://www.arunachala-ramana.org/forum/index.php?topic=5176.0  
 **But his overall detachment to his body and his non-cooperation towards his  
body are amazing and are the key points we need to implement.**   
 **As guru ramana says Insensibility to pain cannot be Jnana.**   
Key point to know is mind/body are mithya i.e dependent on our real nature  
sat-chit-ananda.

## Re:[66]ఓం నమో భగవతే శ్రీ రమణాయ  Is 'Awareness Watching Awareness'-method same as Sri Bhagavan's Self- Attenti  
Author: prasanth_ramana_maharshiDate: June 30, 2010, 10:56:16 AM  
---  
well said udai garu.   
Moreover manonasha is not absolute destruction of mind as few people  
misinterpret guru ramana's teachings saying that he meant absolute destruction  
of mind.Killing of ego is the main key point and there is no need to stop and  
kill thoughts but control of thoughts is required and as lord krishna says in  
bhagavad gita it is possible by constant practice and detachment though it is  
very very difficult.   
Lets say i feel hungry and ask for food if someone comes and say that is only  
your thought so please remove that thought. How do i feel :-)   
Quote  
D: That means the manonasha or the ahamkara nasha. **The destruction of the  
mind or of the ego you speak of is then not an absolute destruction.   
M: Yes. The mind gets clear of impurities and become pure enough to reflect  
the truth, the real Self.This is impossible when the ego is active and  
assertive.**   
 **Source** : Book Extracts (Sat-Darshana-Bashya and Talks with Maharshi)
